title: Platform Application Support
description:
**Company Description** **Who are we?**


In the fast\\-growing economies of the world, there’s a new generation of ambitious younger people eager to gain financial independence. And they’re turning to the world’s financial markets to achieve it. Exinity’s mission is to empower them to succeed. We design, engineer and market a growing range of innovative trading and investing products that meet their expectations for choice, creativity and control, and which are backed by risk management tools, education \\- and a great customer experience.


For over 20 years, Exinity has provided leveraged trading to some two million customers through our global brands Alpari and FXTM. Now, we are adding further brands to our portfolio – with a further three planned for rollout by the end of 2022\\.


Exinity is an energetic and diverse company with offices across Europe, Asia and Africa, and we’re always looking for talented individuals to join us. ‘Freedom to Succeed’ is not just a promise we make to our clients and partners, but to our people too. We’ll help you develop a range of skills, take on early responsibility, and enjoy a rewarding and fulfilling career with a fast\\-growing, dynamic company.

 **Job Description** **Roles and Responsibilities :**

* Provide level 1 support of our trading and non\\-trading systems.
* Must be willing to work in a shift Rota including Weekends.
* Incident \\& Problem Creation – create incident and problem tickets within system.
* Incident Liaison – update incident system \\& Business with development.
* Incident Support – Work with technical Teams and business to help document post recovery steps, processes and Playbooks.
* RCA Support \\& Monitoring – work with Incident Manager to get RCAs completed and tracked.
* Incident Reporting – Help Pull Incident statistics on a weekly, monthly and Ad hoc basis.
* Document outages along with taking active role in Incident Management and interact with Level 2 Team for issue escalation.
* Monitor health and status of the platforms to ensure stable work of services and performance as expected.
* Develop and maintain technical support documentation
* Investigation of user queries via log file and process interaction, e.g. order issues, flow breaks, booking issues and Pricing.
* Escalate urgent problems requiring more in\\-depth knowledge to appropriate internal or external resources
* Working Closely with Dev Ops, QA, Dev and Infrastructure teams for software and scripts roll outs in using best practices from IT Service Management/ITIL
* Perform daily run book activities and provide daily shift turnover reports.
* Perform post release testing after application upgrades and/or releases when required.
* Interaction with Offshore teams and be able to communicate issues effectively and with clarity.


Problem solving and diagnosis of incidents reported to L1 Team and determination of priority and scope of the issue and appropriate escalation Knowledge and Experience

 **Qualifications** **Essential:**

* Ideally Graduate Level (not a must though)
* Must have a minimum of 3 years’ experience in an application support role L1\\.
* Ability to run ad\\-hoc SQL Queries provided by L2 or dev teams.
* Basic SQL Exposure Required.
* Must be a Team Player and ability to work under pressure.
* Excellent troubleshooting/problem solving skills across a wide variety of technologies and disciplines.
* Previous experience in supporting multi\\-tiered applications.
* Fluent English (written and spoken).
* Passion for technology, willingness to learn and self\\-improve
* Ability to prioritize and work independently and places high value on improving process and procedures.
* Weekend Shift Work is required covering weekends along with working in shift Rota in a 24/7 environment.
* Exposure to monitoring tools is a requirement such as Zabbix/Kibana/Grafana or similar.
* Exposure to Jira or similar ticketing system is a must.
* Excellent analytical and problem\\-solving skills.
* Exceptional attention to detail.
* Window Operating system Exposure in must. Understanding of window services and IIS and basic understanding of telemetry.

**Desirable:**

* Experience in MT4/MT5 administration/support will be considered as an advantage
* Knowledge of Linux command shell navigation.
* Power shell or Jenkins Exposure will be handy.
* Experience with FIX/Exchange protocols a plus.
* Experience within the financial sector ideally in a Trading Environment.
* Connectivity and order routing in an equity trading environment
* Understanding of messaging systems e.g. Messaging Queues
* Understanding of Site Reliability Engineering and DevOps concepts and practices
* Exposure to ITIL practices is a plus

title: IT Quality Assurance (Q A ) Automation
description:
**Job Summary**A Quality Assurance Engineer with 1\\-5 years of experience is needed to contribute to the testing and quality management processes in a dynamic and collaborative environment. The role requires strong technical skills, proficiency in QA/TE/SDET, and a keen eye for detail. The ideal candidate will be responsible for developing and executing test plans, performing manual and automated testing, identifying defects, and ensuring that products meet both business and technical requirements. In addition to testing, the role involves performance testing and working closely with cross\\-functional teams to ensure product quality throughout the development lifecycle.  
**Requirement**

* Bachelor’s degree in Engineering (Computer Science, Informatics) or equivalent. Open to non\\-engineering backgrounds with strong technical expertise.
* 1\\-5 years of experience in QA/TE/SDET or a similar field
* Strong technical and programming skills
* Strong analytical and problem\\-solving skills
* Proficiency in quality management software (e.g., Jira)
* Strong attention to detail and accuracy
* Effective communication and teamwork skills

**Qualifications**

* **Testing Skills**: Knowledge of testing types (Smoke, Regression, Sanity), testing techniques (Decision Table, Black Box, etc), and bug management.
* **Programming**: Familiarity with basic programming concepts (variables, data structures, functions, and async programming) in one or more languages such as **JavaScript**, **Java**, **Python**, or similar.
* **Automation Frameworks**: Experience with one or more frameworks like **Cypress, WebdriverIO**, **Appium**, or **k6** for API and web automation, Mobile Automation.
* **Software Tools**: Basic Git, Linux, SQL, and understanding of REST APIs.

**Key ResponsibilitiesTesting Domain**

* Develop and document test plans, test cases, and test strategies.
* Execute manual and automated tests (regression, integration, UAT, system, etc.).
* Identify, log, and track defects in defect tracking systems (e.g., Jira).
* Ensure comprehensive test coverage and measure effectiveness.
* Monitor and report key test metrics (pass/fail rates, defect density, etc.).
* Collaborate with cross\\-functional teams (e.g., development, product).

**Product Analysis**

* Review product specifications, user stories, and acceptance criteria.
* Conduct risk\\-based testing to prioritize critical product areas.
* Perform usability testing to identify UI/UX issues.
* Validate product features against business requirements.
* Track product versions and ensure feature testing aligns with release stages.

**Technical Analysis**

* Perform performance testing to identify and resolve bottlenecks.
* Evaluate scalability by testing system performance under load.
* Test APIs and integrations to ensure system interoperability.

**Automation Testing**

* Develop and maintain test automation (e.g., Cypress, etc.).
* Write, execute, and maintain automated test scripts.
* Generate and analyze detailed test reports.
* Update and maintain automation scripts based on product changes.
* Contribute to the test automation strategy and prioritize which tests to automate.

title: QA Engineer – Property Investment & Finance Group (Kerobokan)
description:
Our client, a fast\\-growing property investment and finance group based in Bali, is seeking a skilled and detail\\-oriented QA Engineer to join their expanding technology team. This role offers the opportunity to play a crucial part in maintaining and improving the quality of the company’s digital platforms and software solutions.

As a QA Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and executing effective testing frameworks to ensure that all software products meet the highest standards of performance, functionality, and reliability. You will collaborate closely with developers and other stakeholders throughout the product development lifecycle, ensuring that every release is tested thoroughly and delivered flawlessly.

**Requirements:**

* Open to local candidates only.
* Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
* At least two years of professional experience as a QA Engineer; prior experience as an SDET (Software Development Engineer in Test) is essential.
* Holding a relevant professional certification (A4Q SDET) is highly preferred.
* Experience or familiarity with property development or financial services industries will be an advantage.
* Proficient in automated testing tools such as Playwright, Selenium, and Cypress.
* Strong knowledge of SQL \\& NoSQL queries and API testing using tools like Postman or Swagger.
* Exceptional analytical thinking and problem\\-solving skills with a keen eye for detail.
* Excellent communication and collaboration abilities to work effectively with cross\\-functional teams.
* Fluent in both English and Bahasa Indonesia.

**Responsibilities:**

* Design, develop, and execute test plans, cases, and scripts for manual and automated testing.
* Conduct various testing types including functional, regression, performance, and usability testing across platforms.
* Detect, document, and monitor bugs and issues using appropriate tracking tools.
* Define and analyze QA metrics, such as defect density, test coverage, and open defect counts, to evaluate quality levels.
* Prepare and deliver comprehensive reports on test progress, outcomes, and recommendations for improvement.
* Perform UI/UX and API testing to ensure an optimal user experience.
* Build and maintain automated testing frameworks to streamline processes and improve reliability.
* Write, execute, and debug automated test scripts while continuously enhancing test automation coverage.
* Integrate automated tests within CI/CD pipelines to support continuous delivery and deployment.
* Work collaboratively with developers, project managers, and stakeholders to understand project requirements and deliver high\\-quality outcomes.
* Communicate testing updates, risks, and findings in a clear and timely manner to all relevant parties.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive salary aligned with experience and skill level.
* BPJS and Religious Holiday Allowance (THR).

title: Observability Engineer [NOC] - ID (Ref: 25-085)
description:
We are seeking a NOC Observability Engineer to Join our SiteOps team for monitoring our systems and applications. In this role, you will be responsible for the optimal performance and availability of Dropsuite's cloud and private infrastructure through active 24x7 monitoring of the infrastructure and performing surveillance of our computer systems, applications, and related networks \\& security.  



This role involves actively monitoring systems, identifying \\& resolving issues in the capacity of a Level 1 engineer, and providing timely response \\& escalation of all incidents, outages, and performance alerts.  



**Work Arrangement**

* Full\\-time position
* Onsite work model (5 days per week in the office on a shift basis)
Eligible to reside and work in Bandung (Indonesian citizenship only)  
* 

*This position is open exclusively to candidates who reside in and are authorised to work in* ***Indonesia.*** *Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.*

**Key Accountabilities**

* Monitoring the performance and availability of Dropsuite’s Saas products on the cloud which includes compute, applications, networks, security, and all other elements via our observability platform.
* Monitor our internal endpoints, ensure compliance with our security policies and practices, identify potential security threats, and collaborate with the security team to implement necessary measures.
* Perform regular health checks on all our infrastructure.
* Proactively responds to all alarms and alerts and determines whether triggered alerts warrant further investigation and verification.
* Performs first\\-level troubleshooting.
* Investigate and escalate alerts triggered to the respective escalation stakeholders for Level 2 support.
* Understand and follow steps as prescribed by internal processes
* Promptly communicate incident status and update respective parties.
* Make end\\-to\\-end follow\\-ups with respective escalation stakeholders.
* Responsible to create and track trouble tickets to closure.
* Participate in incident management processes, prioritize incidents based on severity, and ensure timely incident resolution within defined SLAs.
* Provide status updates and reports on all our system performance, uptime, incident statistics, and other relevant metrics to stakeholders.
* Stay updated with emerging network technologies, industry trends, and best practices through continuous learning and professional development.
* Contribute to process improvements within the NOC environment to enhance operational efficiency.
* Provide technical support and guidance to other cross\\-functional teams as needed.
Tracking and documenting systems \\& applications issues and compiling incident reports.  
* 

**Qualifications and Competencies**

* Diploma or Degree in computer science or a related field.
* Minimum 3 years of experience in an established IT helpdesk/ Technical Support / NOC environment.
* Humble and curious attitude: you are keen to understand how things work.
* Knowledge of cloud infrastructure such as AWS and/or GCP.
* Knowledge of monitoring systems such as Datadog, Grafana, Zabbix, etc.
* Strong problem\\-solving, troubleshooting, and system analysis mindset.
* Know when to escalate or ask for help vs having to own and resolve the issue in isolation.
* Prior experience in a service provider data center is an advantage.
* Strong sense of accountability and urgency.
* Ability to work on rotational shifts and flexible hours.
* Clear communicator, confident, self\\-sufficient, focused, and determined.
* Knowledge of technology architecture for large\\-scale systems is a plus.
* Has a software development background or operations/infrastructure.
* Open and candid about discussing solutions, problems, and improvements.
* Has a passion for SRE principles and their adoption, to steer promised reliability, performance, and security of the applications, services, and systems.
A fan of the DevOps approach, promoting a loosely coupled, heavily automated, and constantly monitored distributed system.  
* 

**Why Join Us**  

At Dropsuite, now proudly part of NinjaOne, we are on a mission to safeguard business information and help businesses stay in business. We are a global, fast\\-growing, partner\\-centric company building secure, scalable, and highly usable cloud backup technologies for businesses of all sizes. Today, we perform billions of backups daily for organizations across more than 100 countries.  



As we enter an exciting new chapter with NinjaOne—a leader in endpoint management, security, and IT automation—our combined strengths enable us to drive even greater impact, innovation, and global scale. Together, we are building a world\\-class platform that empowers IT teams with simplicity, performance, and reliability.  



At our core, we are a team of hungry owners: we are tenacious in our pursuit of excellence and take full ownership in everything we do. We are deeply customer\\-focused, collaborative, and solutions\\-driven. We play as a team—respecting, supporting, and elevating one another every step of the way.  



Join us as we shape the future of IT and data protection—powered by passion, purpose, and the spirit of ownership.

Work in a global company with meaningful work, highly skilled colleagues and an amazing culture

title: Full Stack Software Engineer (Healthcare Focus)
description:

**Job Description**:

We are seeking an experienced Full\\-Stack Software Engineer with specialized expertise in healthcare technology to join our team in Indonesia. The ideal candidate will possess 5\\-8 years of professional engineering experience with a consistent background in healthcare\\-related software development. Candidates with sustained experience in the healthcare industry are highly preferred. You will play a critical role in developing and integrating solutions that directly impact healthcare delivery and data interoperability.

**Key Responsibilities:**

· Design and implement healthcare system integrations using HL7, FHIR, and Web Services standards

· Develop and maintain systems for healthcare data exchange and interoperability

· Design, develop, and maintain scalable healthcare software applications

· Build and optimize features across both front\\-end and back\\-end systems

· Collaborate with healthcare professionals and cross\\-functional teams to deliver compliant, robust solutions

· Conduct code reviews, write unit tests, and maintain healthcare\\-grade code quality

**Why Join Us:**

· Opportunity to make a meaningful impact in healthcare technology

· Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package

· Professional growth in the rapidly expanding digital health sector

· Collaborative environment at the forefront of healthcare innovation

title: Software Support Engineer
description:
**The Company:** We are Hexagon. At Hexagon, we do not just measure the world – we define its future. As the global leader in measurement technologies, we provide the confidence that vital industries rely on to build, navigate, and innovate. We bridge the physical and digital worlds with cutting\\-edge metrology, reality capture, and positioning solutions – making industries and cities safer, smarter, and more sustainable.

**Hexagon Autonomous Solution** comprises of three divisions: Agriculture, Autonomy \\& Positioning and Mining – Providing a breadth of perception, positioning, vehicle autonomy and site orchestration technologies to enable the full autonomous solutions for the agriculture, mining, automotive and marine sectors.

**Hexagon Mining Division**: One technology partner. For the life of your mine. Our mining technologies provide surveying, design, fleet management, production optimisation and collision avoidance capabilities in a life\\-of\\-mine solution that connects people and processes, reduces costs and improves the safety and productivity of mine sites.

**The Position:** Reporting to Software Support Team Lead, we are seeking a Software Support Engineer, to join APAC Technical Service \\& Support team, in Balikpapan. The role of the Support Engineer will look after our diverse technology portfolio through providing remote technical assistance with the quarterly site visits to a growing range of clients in the Asia\\-Pacific (APAC) region. This will see you join a rotation of being on call once per month within day shift/after hour requirement to support our clients


Furthermore, you will ensure Hexagon Mining technology systems at customer mine sites operate effectively and deliver tangible value to our customers mining operations. As a Software Support Engineer your responsibilities will be not limited to the following responsibilities.

**Technical**

* Partner with the Product Development team to assist in capturing and identifying information about system issues (defects) when escalation is required
* Support and maintain software deployed at remote mining sites, providing ongoing support for troubleshooting/problems solving customer may face.
* Investigation and resolution of issues including performance monitoring.

**Operational**

* Reporting and documentation requirements as required
* Maintain, enhance and adhere to Hexagon Mining documentation and reporting standards, systems and processes
* Representing Hexagon Mining in a helpful, professional and courteous manner at all times
* Compliance with Hexagon Mining’s Workplace Health and Safety policies and procedures (and those of clients’ sites visited), participation in audits and compliance with instructions given in respect to the health and safety of himself / herself and the safety of others

**Customer Service \\& Support**

* Be part of on call support roster to provide continuous support to customer service sites
* Act as a dedicated customer support advocate and manage the technical issues for key customer accounts.
* Partner with Account Managers to ensure that customer accounts are in a healthy state with the Hexagon systems they own.

**About you**


We are looking for an experienced/Product/Support/Software Engineer with experience within who is ready for the next step in their career, where your knowledge, skills, experience and passion can be brought to the forefront of your role.

**Technical**

* Tertiary Qualifications in Computer Science, Computer Engineering / Electrical Engineering / Software Engineering or related fields
* Experienced in networking, database administration
* Prior exposure with virtual machines would be desirable
* Knowledge of C\\+\\+ OR Objective\\-C programming languages
* At least 3 years experience scripting languages (bash, perl, python etc.)
* Experience with relational (PostgreSQL, Microsoft SQL Server) or NoSQL databases (MongoDB)
* Prior experience within mining, ideally across Fleet Management Systems/safety system product suites
* Experience working in the mining industry. Global experience desirable.
* Experience with wireless networks, switches and routing would be an advantage

**General**

* **Initiative \\& Self driven:** Able to establish own time management/routine to meet deliverables
* **Agility:** Able to adapt to changing requirement from business or customer, proactively pivot to new directions
* **Customer Centric \\& Solution Focused:** Ensure our customer service lifecycle is delivered in partnership, solution driven in our engagement
* **Collaborative:** Build cohesive working relationships with multi\\-functional teams' internal/external, work in a multi located team environment.
* **Thrive in Dynamic Environments**: Curious and proactive in navigating evolving landscapes
* **Working Rights**: Working rights within relative country
* Fluent in both indonesian and English language, verbal and written

title: PACS and DICOM Integration Support Engineer
description:
**Informasi Lowongan**

**Tipe Pekerjaan** **Remote/On\\-site** **Fungsi Pekerjaan**
TI, Systems Analyst, TI, Systems Engineer, TI, Programmer, Full Stack Developer

**Jenjang Karir**
Pemula / Staf, Staf Senior

**Job Deskripsi**
The Role:



The primary responsibility of an Integration Support Engineer is technical integration and support for our customer base, both directly and indirectly. In this role, you will be responsible for successfully installing, controlling, supporting, and monitoring all Dicom Systems technical projects.



You will perform configuration, support, administration, and clinical user training throughout the customer’s medical imaging enterprise and integrate with other information systems across multiple healthcare facilities. Your duties will span various customer IT environments and secure hybrid network architecture, including high latency, low bandwidth, complex priority routing management, DICOM, HL7, FHIR, RESTful services, and IHE cross\\-enterprise integration.



The Integration Support Engineer provides all direct and indirect support to Dicom Systems customers, including, but not limited to, cloud storage configuration and management and multi\\-vendor training on imaging device installation, configuration, management, and service. You will work with internal teams and Healthcare IT/informatics departments at medical facilities, large and small. All work is performed remotely.



A technical understanding of imaging informatics, DICOM, HL7, databases, clinical imaging workflows, networking, and Healthcare IT in general is required. The Integration Support Engineer must possess superb organizational skills, practical time management skills, be detail\\-oriented, and maintain meticulous documentation.



The successful candidate must have a solid command of the English language, be an effective verbal and written communicator, and be able to multitask.



The primary duties include, but are not limited to:



Develop proficiency in the company’s software solutions, solution methodologies, and core technologies.



Implement proprietary software to support DICOM, HL7, and medical image migrations.



Verify software modifications, changes, and enhancements and submit test results findings to software development.



Maintain and update internal databases, outlining all interactions throughout the project lifecycle.



Create process optimization improvements to enhance the department and its offerings.



Respond to customer inquiries quickly and maintain excellent customer service.



Conduct and participate in all teleconference calls



Monitor, maintain, and ensure your projects are progressing appropriately.



Reviewing and analyzing software and hardware needs for upcoming projects



Developing a comprehensive understanding of all services provided and being prepared to implement them at customer facilities



Maintenance of the monitoring systems for proactive monitoring



Participate in the help desk, answer support calls and emails, and provide 24/7 on\\-call support rotation for customers.



Create and implement plans for deploying new hardware and VM systems, such as VMware, Hyper\\-V, and Cloud environments. Work directly with software engineers to define and document an application’s deployment process.



Meticulously uphold HIPAA privacy and security regulations and company security policies while performing duties.

S2, S1, D3

Analis Kesehatan, Ilmu Komputer, Kesehatan Masyarakat, Radiografer

3 tahun

**Deskripsi Persyaratan**
Technical Requirements:



Knowledge of networking protocols (such as TCP/IP).



Excellent verbal and written English communication skills.



Strong understanding of DICOM, HL7, and PACS



Excellent understanding of generic networking technology (Hardware and Software)



Knowledge of computer HW (Drives, memory, CPU, storage)



Demonstrated problem\\-solving/troubleshooting abilities.



Must be a team player with the initiative and drive to do whatever it takes to ensure systems are stable and efficient.



BS in Computer Science or Biomedical Engineering or equivalent experience. NAS, RAID configuration ability a plus, MS Certificate Services a plus, not required



A\\+ Certification a plus, not required; NET\\+ Certification a plus, not required



Five years experience installing and administering UNIX systems in a 24×7 environment.



Experience with Linux systems running web\\-based applications.



Ability to write shell scripts (bash preferred).

title: Mechanical Materials Engineer
description:
**Title:**


Mechanical Materials Engineer
KBR’s Sustainable Technology Solutions (STS) group is looking for a Mechanical Materials Engineer to support the Abadi LNG project, one of the largest projects in Asia. This project will provide front\\-end design (FEED) for onshore liquefied natural gas facilities \\& will have a peak production capacity targets of 9\\.5 million tons per annum of LNG and 150 million standard cubic feet per day of pipeline gas. The Abadi LNG project has been designated a project of national strategic importance by the Indonesian government.


The Mechanical Materials Engineer will lead the material selection study, develop suitable corrosion control strategy and implement corrosion monitoring philosophy for the Abadi Project. This role will develop and update Engineering guidelines, specifications and best practices within Metallurgy, Welding, Coatings and Corrosion Control for the project.


**Responsibilities:**

* Conduct Erosion / Corrosion modeling /prediction / Assessment studies using latest software program for services in Oil and Gas industry
* Study and develop Material Selection Philosophy (MSP), Material Selection Diagram (MSD) and Material Selection Report (MSR) during Concept, Pre\\-Feed, FEED and Detail Engineering phases of the Project
* Review related detailed design specifications and drawings, submitted by Contractors and Consulting Engineers for compliance with Design Basis, Specifications, Codes, Standards and Industry Practices
* Review and endorse Consultant/Contractor's design and coordinate the material and corrosion design review, evaluate options and select best techno\\-economic solutions
* Provide technical support related to material and corrosion to the Project during Concept, Pre FEED, FEED, detailed engineering, procurement, fabrication, testing, installation commissioning and start\\-up stages of the project
* Advise corrosion monitoring product specification, material selection, identifying monitoring locations, selection criteria for the periodic inspection of facilities covering both Offshore assets in upstream, midstream \\& downstream Oil \\& Gas, LNG, refinery and petrochemical facilities

**Required Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Materials Science, Metallurgical / Mechanical engineering or related field
* Minimum of 7 years of years relevant experience in Materials and corrosion Engineering in Oil \\& Gas Industry with a premier Engineering Consultant or Oil \\& Gas Company
* Working knowledge with international design codes, standards and Company standards and procedure and design software packages such as Predict, ECE5, Hydrocor, and Norsok M506 etc
* Highly proficient with relevant industry standards (API, NACE, ISO, NORSOK, DNV, ASME, ASTM, etc.) as well as design and fabrication requirements for Oil and Gas projects
* Proven ability with material selection, evaluating corrosion control strategies and implementing corrosion monitoring techniques covering both Offshore assets in upstream, midstream \\& downstream Oil \\& Gas, Refinery and Petro chemical facilities
* Fully familiar with corrosion problems associated with projects for tubing \\& X\\-Mas trees, pipelines, valves, piping, vessels \\& exchangers and rotating equipment in Oil and Gas industry
* Experienced in coordinating with expert Contractor/Vendor representatives during contractor selection, drawings review and start\\-up phases
* Strong technical, planning, communication, presentation and reporting skills

**Decarbonization – Energy Transition – Sustainability**
========================================================

title: Civil Underground Engineer
description:
**Title:**


Civil Underground Engineer
KBR’s Sustainable Technology Solutions (STS) group is looking for a Civil Underground Engineer to support the Abadi LNG project, one of the largest projects in Asia. This project will provide front\\-end design (FEED) for onshore liquefied natural gas facilities \\& will have a peak production capacity targets of 9\\.5 million tons per annum of LNG and 150 million standard cubic feet per day of pipeline gas. The Abadi LNG project has been designated a project of national strategic importance by the Indonesian government.


The Civil Underground Engineer will design and develop underground systems including stormwater drainage, sewerage, firewater, potable water, oily water, and utility trenches. This role will coordinate with geotechnical, structural, piping, and electrical teams to ensure integrated design solutions.


**Responsibilities:**

* Prepare and review engineering deliverables such as layouts, profiles, cross\\-sections, material take\\-offs, and technical specifications
* Perform hydraulic and structural calculations for underground piping and culverts
* Support construction teams with technical guidance, field inspections, and resolution of underground\\-related issues
* Ensure compliance with project standards, local regulations, and international codes (e.g., ASCE, API, AWWA)
* Participate in design reviews, risk assessments, and constructability workshops

**Required Qualifications:**

* Minimum of 7 years of civil/structural analysis/design engineering experience, with average experience of 10 \\+ years
* Proficiency in engineering software such as AutoCAD Civil 3D, Bentley OpenRoads, StormCAD, or equivalent

title: Engineering Manager : Offsite Discovery (Remote)
description:
### **About Us**


Constructor is the next\\-generation platform for search and discovery in ecommerce, built to explicitly optimize for metrics like revenue, conversion rate, and profit. Our search engine is entirely invented in\\-house utilizing transformers and generative LLMs, and we use its core and personalization capabilities to power everything from search itself to recommendations to shopping agents. Engineering is by far our largest department, and we’ve built our proprietary engine to be the best on the market, having never lost an A/B test to a competitive technology. We’re passionate about maintaining this and work on the bleeding edge of AI to do so.


Out of necessity, our engine is built for extreme scale and powers over 1 billion queries every day across 150 languages and roughly 100 countries. It is used by some of the biggest ecommerce companies in the world like Sephora, Under Armour, and Petco.


We’re a passionate team who love solving problems and want to make our customers’ and coworkers’ lives better. We value empathy, openness, curiosity, continuous improvement, and are excited by metrics that matter. We believe that empowering everyone in a company to do what they do best can lead to great things.


Constructor is a U.S. based company that has been in the market since 2019\\. It was founded by Eli Finkelshteyn and Dan McCormick who still lead the company today.


We're building the next generation of e\\-commerce, creating entirely new ways for shoppers to discover products. As an engineer in the Merchant Tools team, you will be working to create and maintain the foundation for the application that is currently used by merchandisers of global e\\-commerce brands to manage the shopper product discovery experience worldwide. Your work will be the backbone of the platform, maintaining its stability and security, while enabling other teams to deliver work efficiently. You will also be able to own specific product areas that affect the platform as a whole such as authentication and authorization, audit logging and much more.


We’re looking for an engineer with 4\\+ years of experience, a strong frontend background, and proficiency in at least one backend stack, who can launch and maintain multiple services that enable other teams to build features on top of them. Excellent communication and collaboration skills are essential, as you’ll work closely with multiple teams to coordinate efforts and ensure smooth cross\\-functional delivery. Experience with infrastructure is a plus, as we’re restructuring our systems to make them more stable and faster to support our growing team.

### **About the Team**


The Recommendation Cross\\-Channel \\& Offsite Discovery team is building a platform that empowers marketers to unlock the full potential of multichannel ecommerce discovery. Our service leverages real\\-time shopper behaviour from website activity to power personalized offsite experiences across multiple channels \\- including Emails, Push notifications, ads, and more.


In a nutshell, we provide real\\-time personalized experience in static emails and specialize in delivering high\\-volume traffic (up to 10,000 requests per second). Our goal is to show shoppers what they want, when they want it \\- boosting engagement, driving revenue, and delivering robust campaign analytics insights at scale.


We're a passionate team of cross\\-functional engineers who love challenges and want to make shoppers' lives better. We value empathy, openness, curiosity, continuous improvement, and great code. We believe that empowering everyone in a company to do what they think is best can lead to great things.

### **Responsibilities**


As an Engineering Manager, you will be responsible for leading and scaling the Offsite Discovery team to build a performant, scalable, reliable, and cost\\-efficient platform that delivers personalized results beyond the storefront. Specific responsibilities include:

* Partner with the Product Manager and other stakeholders to set quarterly goals tied to measurable service and business impact
* Guide engineers’ growth by helping them develop new skills, expand ownership, and overcome challenges
* Lead the recruiting and hiring processes for your team
* Define and execute the team’s engineering strategy
* Establish metrics, dashboards, and alerting that make operational health and delivery success transparent
* Continuously improve the team’s operational excellence through the team’s tech stack, processes, and tools
* Drive measurable improvements in the product capabilities, costs, and performance
* Collaborate with neighboring engineering and non\\-engineering teams, define and maintain clear interfaces and ownership boundaries

**Requirements**

* 5\\+ years of software development experience, at least 2 years directly leading engineering teams
* Proven record of designing and operating high\\-load real\\-time systems in production environments
* Proficiency in Python and experience with at least one major cloud platform (AWS preferred). Familiarity with JavaScript is a plus
* Solid understanding of system architecture and API design principles
* Experience hiring, mentoring, and developing engineers in fast\\-growing teams
* Skilled at setting technical direction and translating product goals into clear engineering milestones
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English
* Able to attend regular meetings between 11 am – 5 pm UTC

**Benefits**


* ️ Unlimited vacation time \\- we strongly encourage all of our employees take at least 3 weeks per year
* Fully remote team \\- choose where you live
* ️ Work from home stipend! We want you to have the resources you need to set up your home office
* Apple laptops provided for new employees

‍* Training and development budget for every employee, refreshed each year
* Maternity \\& Paternity leave for qualified employees
* Work with smart people who will help you grow and make a meaningful impact
* This position has a base salary range between $100k and $130k USD. The offer varies on many factors including job related knowledge, skills, experience, and interview results.
* Regular team offsites to connect and collaborate

### **Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion at Constructor**


At Constructor.io we are committed to cultivating a work environment that is diverse, equitable, and inclusive. As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome individuals of all backgrounds and provide equal opportunities to all applicants regardless of their education, diversity of opinion, race, color, religion, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status or affiliation in any other protected group.


*Studies have shown that women and people of color may be less likely to apply for jobs unless they meet every one of the qualifications listed. Our primary interest is in finding the best candidate for the job. We encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet all of our listed qualifications.*

title: Data & AI Presales Consultant (Indonesia)
description:
Job Function: Sales The role:

Are you ready to architect transformative data and AI solutions?  

Do you thrive on turning complex information into business advantage?  

Would you like to work with cutting\\-edge cloud technologies to unlock insights for our organisation?  

You’ll join our **Data \\& Analytics team**, partnering with business stakeholders across the organisation to drive innovation in how we collect, model and act on information.  

As the Solution Architect for Data \\& AI, you play a pivotal part in shaping how our business harnesses its data. You design and build the blueprint for our analytics and generative\\-AI capabilities on the AWS platform so that teams can make better decisions, solve complex problems and deliver value. **What You’ll Do:*** Design end\\-to\\-end analytics and AI solutions: Work with stakeholders to gather needs, sketch the architecture and document the big picture.
* Architect on AWS: Apply your expertise with services such as Redshift, EMR, Kinesis, Glue, QuickSight and the suite of AI/ML and generative\\-AI tools to build robust, scalable platforms.
* Model and integrate data: Define clean data models and ETL patterns, bring data in from diverse sources, optimise for performance and maintain integrity.
* Ensure scale, security and performance: Build solutions that grow with us, run efficiently, protect sensitive information and meet compliance standards.
* Troubleshoot and optimise: Spot bottlenecks or quality issues, propose creative fixes and tune the environment as it runs.
* Collaborate and innovate: Partner with engineers, scientists and analysts; contribute ideas, stay up\\-to\\-date with emerging tech and help raise the bar on what our data estate can do.


What we need to see from you:
* A proven track record designing and delivering data\\-centric solutions in the cloud – you speak the language of data modelling, warehousing, ETL and governance and you’ve seen ideas through from concept into production.
* Deep familiarity with the AWS analytics and AI family (Redshift, EMR, Kinesis, Glue, QuickSight and related AI/ML/generative\\-AI offerings) and an enthusiasm for exploring new services.
* Comfort writing code and queries – you work fluently in Python and SQL (or similar languages) to manipulate, transform and interrogate data.
* Excellent problem\\-solving, communication and collaboration skills – you can translate business questions into technical designs and work effectively with both technical and non\\-technical colleagues.
* Experience working in an Agile environment, version controlling your work and adapting as priorities evolve.
* Relevant qualifications: a degree in an IT\\-related discipline or equivalent, plus current AWS certifications (Solution Architect, Data Analytics Specialty or the equivalent).


Why SoftwareOne?:  

SoftwareOne and Crayon have come together to form a global, AI\\-powered software and cloud solutions provider with a bold vision for the future. With a footprint in over 70 countries and a diverse team of 13,000\\+ professionals, we offer unparalleled opportunities for talent to grow, make an impact, and shape the future of technology. At the heart of our business is our people. We empower our teams to work across borders, innovate fearlessly, and continuously develop their skills through world\\-class learning and development programs. Whether you're passionate about cloud, software, data, AI, or building meaningful client relationships, you’ll find a place to thrive here. Join us and be part of a purpose\\-driven culture where your ideas matter, your growth is supported, and your career can go global.
Accommodations:

SoftwareOne welcomes applicants from all backgrounds and abilities to apply. If you require reasonable adjustments at any point during the recruitment process, email us at reasonable.accommodations@softwareone.com.  

Please include the role for which you are applying and your country location. Someone from our organization that is not part of the decision\\-making process will be in touch to discuss your specific needs and we will make every effort to accommodate you. Any information shared will be stored securely and treated in the strictest of confidence in line with GDPR.  

At SoftwareOne, we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and teammates without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. Additionally, we encourage experienced individuals that have taken an intentional career break and are now prepared to return to work to explore our SOAR program.

title: Data & AI Presales Consultant (Indonesia)
description:
**Why SoftwareOne?**  

SoftwareOne and Crayon have come together to form a global, AI\\-powered software and cloud solutions provider with a bold vision for the future. With a footprint in over 70 countries and a diverse team of 13,000\\+ professionals, we offer unparalleled opportunities for talent to grow, make an impact, and shape the future of technology. At the heart of our business is our people. We empower our teams to work across borders, innovate fearlessly, and continuously develop their skills through world\\-class learning and development programs. Whether you're passionate about cloud, software, data, AI, or building meaningful client relationships, you’ll find a place to thrive here. Join us and be part of a purpose\\-driven culture where your ideas matter, your growth is supported, and your career can go global.  

  

**The role**  

Are you ready to architect transformative data and AI solutions?  

Do you thrive on turning complex information into business advantage?  

Would you like to work with cutting\\-edge cloud technologies to unlock insights for our organisation?  

You’ll join our **Data \\& Analytics team**, partnering with business stakeholders across the organisation to drive innovation in how we collect, model and act on information.  

As the Solution Architect for Data \\& AI, you play a pivotal part in shaping how our business harnesses its data. You design and build the blueprint for our analytics and generative\\-AI capabilities on the AWS platform so that teams can make better decisions, solve complex problems and deliver value. **What You’ll Do:*** Design end\\-to\\-end analytics and AI solutions: Work with stakeholders to gather needs, sketch the architecture and document the big picture.
* Architect on AWS: Apply your expertise with services such as Redshift, EMR, Kinesis, Glue, QuickSight and the suite of AI/ML and generative\\-AI tools to build robust, scalable platforms.
* Model and integrate data: Define clean data models and ETL patterns, bring data in from diverse sources, optimise for performance and maintain integrity.
* Ensure scale, security and performance: Build solutions that grow with us, run efficiently, protect sensitive information and meet compliance standards.
* Troubleshoot and optimise: Spot bottlenecks or quality issues, propose creative fixes and tune the environment as it runs.
* Collaborate and innovate: Partner with engineers, scientists and analysts; contribute ideas, stay up\\-to\\-date with emerging tech and help raise the bar on what our data estate can do.


  

**What we need to see from you**  

* A proven track record designing and delivering data\\-centric solutions in the cloud – you speak the language of data modelling, warehousing, ETL and governance and you’ve seen ideas through from concept into production.
* Deep familiarity with the AWS analytics and AI family (Redshift, EMR, Kinesis, Glue, QuickSight and related AI/ML/generative\\-AI offerings) and an enthusiasm for exploring new services.
* Comfort writing code and queries – you work fluently in Python and SQL (or similar languages) to manipulate, transform and interrogate data.
* Excellent problem\\-solving, communication and collaboration skills – you can translate business questions into technical designs and work effectively with both technical and non\\-technical colleagues.
* Experience working in an Agile environment, version controlling your work and adapting as priorities evolve.
* Relevant qualifications: a degree in an IT\\-related discipline or equivalent, plus current AWS certifications (Solution Architect, Data Analytics Specialty or the equivalent).


  

**Job Function**  

  

Sales
  

**Accommodations**  

SoftwareOne welcomes applicants from all backgrounds and abilities to apply. If you require reasonable adjustments at any point during the recruitment process, email us at reasonable.accommodations@softwareone.com.  

Please include the role for which you are applying and your country location. Someone from our organization that is not part of the decision\\-making process will be in touch to discuss your specific needs and we will make every effort to accommodate you. Any information shared will be stored securely and treated in the strictest of confidence in line with GDPR.  

At SoftwareOne, we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and teammates without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. Additionally, we encourage experienced individuals that have taken an intentional career break and are now prepared to return to work to explore our SOAR program.

title: Junior Architect - Architecture & Design Company (Kerobokan)
description:
Our client, a respected architecture and design firm renowned for crafting innovative and sophisticated spaces that seamlessly balance functionality with aesthetic appeal, is seeking a highly motivated Architect to join their team immediately.

This role is ideal for a creative, detail\\-oriented individual with strong conceptual and technical architectural skills. The successful candidate will contribute to a diverse portfolio of high\\-end residential, commercial, and hospitality projects, while expanding their professional expertise within a collaborative, design\\-driven studio environment.

You will play a vital role in supporting the full architectural process from initial concept and design development to technical documentation and on\\-site coordination ensuring design excellence, functionality, and compliance with local regulations throughout every phase of the project.

**Requirements:**

* Open to local candidates only.
* Fresh graduates are welcome to apply; prior internship or hands\\-on project experience will be considered an advantage.
* Basic proficiency in architectural software such as ArchiCAD, Lumion, and Photoshop.
* Ability to produce accurate technical drawings, 3D visualisations, and polished design presentations.
* Strong attention to detail with a keen eye for design aesthetics and spatial composition.
* Demonstrated ability to translate design concepts into practical, functional, and visually compelling architectural solutions.
* Sound understanding of architectural principles, construction methods, and local building codes.
* Effective communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to coordinate across multidisciplinary teams, including designers, engineers, consultants, and project managers.
* Eagerness to learn, grow, and adapt in a fast\\-paced, feedback\\-driven environment.
* Excellent time management and organisational abilities, capable of handling multiple tasks and meeting tight deadlines.

**Responsibilities:**

* Work under the supervision of the Project Manager, providing regular progress updates and design reports.
* Assist in preparing architectural plans, technical drawings, and design documentation according to project specifications and applicable standards.
* Collaborate in the development, refinement, and detailing of building designs, ensuring functionality, safety, and visual integrity.
* Partner with the internal design team, engineers, and external stakeholders to resolve design challenges and achieve aligned project goals.
* Support the creation of 3D models, digital renderings, and presentation materials for internal reviews and client presentations.
* Participate in on\\-site inspections, assisting in monitoring construction progress to ensure adherence to design intent and technical specifications.
* Conduct research on materials, construction techniques, and sustainable design solutions to enhance project outcomes.
* Maintain organised and up\\-to\\-date project documentation throughout the lifecycle of each project.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive base salary based on experience.
* Religious Holiday Allowance (THR).

Job Type: Full\\-time

title: IT Technical Support Engineer (L2) - Bali
description:
**About the Role:**

IT Technical Support Engineer (L2\\) is the first line of contact for our customers. You'll handle initial triage, basic troubleshooting, documentation, and timely escalation across customers in

multiple time zones. This role operates in high pressure environments during incidents and

participates in a rotating shift system that includes occasional midnight and weekend coverage.

When rostered on public holidays, online availability may be required; overtime is compensated per policy through paid OT or time off in lieu (TOIL). Schedules are planned to average 40 hours per week across the roster cycle.

**Main responsibilities:**  
Working alone, or in partnership with the sales, services, and business development teams you will be expected to:

* Provide prompt technical support via phone, email, and chat; log all interactions in the ticketing system.
* Diagnose and resolve common issues (software/hardware/network); perform basic health checks and follow SOPs.
* Escalate complex incidents with clear context and reproduction steps; follow through until resolution.
* Contribute to runbooks, knowledge base articles, and user guides; identify recurring issues and suggest fixes.
* Coordinate effectively with customers and teammates across APAC/EMEA/AMER time zones as scheduled

**Qualifications**

* 1\\+ year in customer service or technical support (internships/projects considered).
* Diploma/degree in IT/Computer Science or equivalent experience.
* Fluent English communication (written and spoken) is mandatory; able to produce incident updates and documentation in English.
* Familiarity with Windows/macOS fundamentals and basic networking (IP/DNS/VPN).
* Experience with ticketing and remote‑support tools; willing and able to work rotating shifts (including midnight) and be online when scheduled on public holidays; log pre‑approved OT/TOIL per policy.

**Nice to have**

* CompTIA A\\+ or ITIL Foundations; exposure to Google Cloud, AWS, or Azure.
* Basic scripting/SQL or monitoring tool experience.

Job Type: Full\\-time

title: Senior iOS Engineer
description:
**Join the revolution in hospitality tech!**

 **Liven** is a leading global data, technology, and customer experience provider for the hospitality industry. From humble beginnings, we have grown to serve over 6,000 venues and millions of diners across Australia, the USA, and Southeast Asia, processing over 120 million transactions worth more than $3 billion (AUD) annually.

  

At **Liven**, our platform is built to help hospitality businesses **save more and work smarter** by seamlessly integrating every aspect of their operations — from **ordering and payments** to **back\\-of\\-house management**.

  

Driven by a deep passion for the hospitality industry, we continuously innovate to elevate the experience for both venues and their guests. Our solutions are powered by **AI\\-enriched insights** and **automated workflows**, enabling smarter decision\\-making and smoother operations at scale.

  

We’re proud to be an **AI\\-first organisation**. By automating repetitive tasks, we free up space for our teams — and our customers — to focus on what truly matters: solving complex problems, delighting guests, and driving meaningful growth.  

  

**Key Milestones:**

* **Expansion:** Acquired OrderUp, Abacus, Zeemart, Copper and Nomnie forming Asia Pacific’s largest end\\-to\\-end group in hospitality technology.
* **Global Reach:** Headquartered across major cities including Melbourne, Brisbane, Sydney, Singapore, Bali, Jakarta, New York, and India.


If you're someone who thrives on creativity, bold thinking, and using technology to make things better, faster, and smarter — you’ll feel right at home here.

 **Here’s a quick glimpse of Liven:**

* You can visit Career
* You can visit LinkedIn
* You can Visit Blog
* Acquisition News

  

We’re looking for a **Senior iOS Engineer** to join our POS team. In this role, you’ll take technical ownership of our iOS\\-based POS product, working on new features, performance improvements, and key architectural components. You’ll work closely with cross\\-platform squads including Android, Backend, QA, and Product to build world\\-class tools for hospitality operators.

 **What you'll do**

* Maintain and evolve Liven’s iOS POS application using **Swift**, **Objective\\-C**, and core iOS frameworks.
* Design and implement new features and UI/UX improvements based on product roadmap.
* Lead the development of reusable components, libraries, and frameworks (including Flutter integrations).
* Integrate the app with backend services, APIs, and hardware relevant to POS operations.
* Monitor crash rates and app performance; target a **20% reduction** in app crashes over 6 months.
* Collaborate closely with Product Managers, QA, and fellow engineers to ensure high\\-quality releases.
* Contribute to and improve CI/CD workflows, automated testing, and deployment processes.
* Mentor junior iOS engineers and help upskill the team through code reviews and pair programming.

**Qualifications**

* **8\\+ years** of software development experience with a focus on iOS.
* **5\\+ years** of hands\\-on experience with **Objective\\-C** and proven contributions to commercial apps.
* Advanced proficiency in **Swift** and strong understanding of **UIKit** and **iOS internals**.
* Experience working with **multithreading**, **design patterns**, and scalable architecture (e.g., MVC, MVVM, Clean).
* Solid experience building **transactional systems** or apps in the **POS domain**.
* Familiarity with **Flutter** and interest in cross\\-platform codebases is a plus.
* Comfortable with tools like **Firebase**, **Crashlytics**, **Fastlane**, and **GitHub Actions**.
* Proven ability to guide junior team members and work effectively within a collaborative environment.
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field.

**Good to Have**

* In\\-depth understanding of **POS workflows** and integrations with payment terminals and other hardware.
* Experience working with **real\\-time data sync**, **WebSockets**, and **push notifications**.
* Exposure to Flutter for shared modules or components.
* Familiarity with App Store review guidelines and release processes.

title: Software Engineering Intern | Mining Technology
description:
The Company: We are Hexagon. At Hexagon, we do not just measure the world – we define its future. As the global leader in measurement technologies, we provide the confidence that vital industries rely on to build, navigate, and innovate.

**The Division:** Hexagon Autonomous Solution comprises of three divisions: Agriculture, Autonomy \\& Positioning and Mining – Providing a breadth of perception, positioning, vehicle autonomy and site orchestration technologies to enable the full autonomous solutions for the agriculture, mining, automotive and marine sectors.

**The Position:** Reporting to the Team Lead, we are seeking a Software Engineering student to join our Software Services \\& Support team in Balikpapan. This internship is for 2025/2026 Academic students. This position is based on\\-site in Balikpapan, Kalimantan Timur. Hours will be part time\\- 2 or 3 days per week Monday to Friday 8\\-5pm and uphold a 6\\-month duration. Commencement in role is planned December 2025

title: Field Service Engineer
description:
**Description**


**The opportunity:**


As a Field Service Engineer at Hitachi Energy, you will be responsible for the installation, maintenance, and repair of Hitachi equipment and systems at customer sites. This entry\\-level role provides a foundational opportunity to develop technical expertise and customer service skills within a dynamic engineering environment.

**How you’ll make an impact:**

* You will assist senior field service engineers with the installation, configuration, and commissioning of Hitachi products and systems at various customer locations.
* You will perform routine preventative maintenance and diagnostics on equipment to ensure optimal performance and minimize downtime, troubleshoot and diagnose technical issues with hardware and software components, utilizing diagnostic tools and technical documentation.
* You will execute repairs and replacements of faulty parts, ensure adherence to Hitachi's quality and safety standards, document all service activities, including detailed reports of installations, maintenance performed, and repairs made.
* You will communicate effectively with customers to explain technical issues, solutions, and preventive measures in a clear and professional manner.
* You will participate in ongoing training and development programs to enhance technical knowledge and skills related to Hitachi's product portfolio, adhere to all company policies, safety regulations, and customer site protocols.
* You will provide basic technical support and guidance to customers as needed, maintain a professional appearance and demeanor while representing Hitachi Energy.
* You will be responsible to ensure compliance with applicable external and internal regulations, procedures, and guidelines.
* Living Hitachi Energy's core values of safety and integrity, which means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues and the business.

**Your background:**

* Bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering or a related technical field.
* Strong foundational understanding of electrical and mechanical principles.
* Excellent problem\\-solving and analytical skills with a keen attention to detail. Proficiency in using basic hand tools and diagnostic equipment.
* Ability to read and interpret technical manuals, schematics, and wiring diagrams. Willingness and ability to travel frequently to customer sites, potentially including overnight stays.
* Basic computer literacy, including proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite. Prior internship or co\\-op experience in a technical or field service role is a plus and customer\\-focused attitude with a commitment to delivering high\\-quality service.
* Proficiency in English communication.

**Qualified individuals with a disability may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Hitachi Energy career site as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by completing a** **general inquiry form** **on our website. Please include your contact information and specific details about your required accommodation to support you during the job application process.**

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description:
Mekari is Indonesia's no. 1 Software\\-as\\-a\\-Service (SaaS) company. With our ecosystem of software solutions—including Mekari Jurnal, Mekari Talenta, Mekari Qontak, and Mekari Flex, we aim to facilitate entrepreneurs and leaders as they accelerate the digital transformation of their businesses.  

  

In our 10\\+ years of journey we have reached over 1 Million platform users, and we're not planning to stop any time soon. We need more people like you: builders and owners with calculated ambition who are ready to **\\#ElevateThroughImpact** and raise Indonesia's software standard.

  


**Job Summary:**



We are seeking a skilled Infrastructure Engineer to join our team, focusing on supporting our on\\-premise and private cloud (single\\-tenant) customers. This role involves handling tasks of medium to low complexity, ensuring the smooth operation and maintenance of our infrastructure solutions. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of both cloud and on\\-premise environments, with expertise in key technologies such as Kubernetes, containerization, Terraform, Ansible, Linux, and customer troubleshooting.


**Responsibilities:**


* Infrastructure Management: Deploy, configure, and maintain on\\-premise and private cloud infrastructure for our enterprise customers.
* Automation and Orchestration: Utilize tools like Terraform and Ansible to automate infrastructure provisioning and configuration, ensuring scalability and efficiency.
* Containerization: Manage and deploy containerized applications using Kubernetes, optimizing resource utilization and application performance.
* Troubleshooting and Support: Provide timely and effective technical support to customers, resolving infrastructure\\-related issues and ensuring high availability.
* Collaboration: Work closely with the infrastructure team and other stakeholders to deliver seamless solutions to our customers.


**Required Skills and Experience:**


* Cloud and On\\-Premise Expertise: Proven experience managing both cloud\\-based and on\\-premise infrastructure environments.
* Kubernetes and Containerization: Strong knowledge of Kubernetes and container orchestration platforms, with experience in deploying and managing containerized applications.
* Infrastructure as Code (IaC): Proficiency in using Terraform or similar tools for infrastructure automation and provisioning.
* Configuration Management: Experience with Ansible or other configuration management tools for automating system configurations.
* Linux Administration: Solid understanding of Linux operating systems and administration tasks.
* Troubleshooting: Excellent problem\\-solving skills and the ability to diagnose and resolve complex technical issues.
* Customer Focus: Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with a focus on delivering exceptional customer service.


**Desired Skills:**


* Scripting: Experience with scripting languages (e.g., Bash, Python) for automation tasks.
* Monitoring: Familiarity with monitoring tools (e.g., Prometheus, Grafana) for infrastructure performance tracking.
* Networking: Understanding of networking concepts and protocols.

  



Our team will review your application and will be in touch if your application is shortlisted to the next stage. If you do not hear from us in 30 days, we will keep your resume on file in case a relevant opportunity opens up.

Don't forget to check our Recruitment FAQ at https://bit.ly/FAQMekariRecruitment \\[ENG] or https://bit.ly/FAQRekrutmenMekari \\[INA] to find the answers to commonly asked questions regarding our recruitment process.

We wish you the best. Hope to see you around soon!

* Solid knowledge of SQL and scripting
* Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development process
* Experience with performance and/or security testing is a plus

title: Software Dev Engineer Lead
description:
Hi, I'm Sushma Nayak your Recruiter. At CSG, we choose to see beyond a resume paper. We put your story, perspective, background, and what you have to offer first. While the traditional approach works for some, many miss out on fantastic talent like yourself, and we refuse to make that mistake. Instead, we believe that by channeling the power of all, we make ordinary customer and employee experiences extraordinary.
What you'll do:* Specification Interpretation, work with Business Analysts and customers to interpret requirements and remove ambiguity over requirements.
* Low Level Software Design, using the high level design and functional design, create the necessary low level software design to meet the functional requirements. Document the design and gain approval from the design authority to ensure the design maintains the overall integrity.
* Software Development, develop the software in accordance with the agreed requirements.
* Unit Testing, develop unit tests for the software that meets the approved low level design. Execute the tests, record deficiencies and remediate as required.
* Software Implementation, develop implementation scripts and deploy developed software into test and production requirements as required.
* Knowledge definition and capture, turn intrinsic knowledge into extrinsic knowledge by actively contributing to knowledge capture systems such as the internal Wiki and document management systems. Conduct team training sessions to both gain and deliver knowledge and experience.
* Team Lead and Mentorship, guide \\& mentor teams of developers.


What you should Have:* Bachelor's degree in software engineering or equivalent experience
* Proficiency in English in a business environment
* 8\\+ years software development experience with modern Java SE (8\\+)
* Experience in PostgreSQL, and REST API frameworks
* Experience in Business Process Management and BPMN libraries (Camunda, Activiti etc.)
* Experience in identity management and authentication (Keycloak)
* Experience in a development, packaging and release toolchain (Github, Maven, Kubernetes, etc.)
* Experience in leading technical team/developers in a software project
* Experience in the banking and financial services domain is preferred


Location(s):
Indonesia Remote
Accommodation:
If you would like to be considered for employment opportunities with CSG and need special assistance due to a disability or accommodation for a disability throughout any aspect of the application process, please call us at \\+1 (402\\) 431\\-7440 or email us at accommodations@csgi.com. CSG provides accommodations for persons with disabilities in employment, including during the hiring process and any interview and/or testing processes.
Our Guiding Principles:
Impact: Always help and empower others, whether they’re colleagues or customers. When our employees set their minds to something, great things happen.
Integrity: Do what’s right for our customers and our people while being authentic. We treat everyone with trust and respect—that’s just who we are.
Inspiration: Be bold in the way you think and passionate about the work you do. Test out innovative ideas without the fear of failure.
Our Story:
CSG empowers companies to build unforgettable experiences, making it easier for people and businesses to connect with, use and pay for the services they value most. For over 40 years, CSG's technologies and people have helped some of the world's most recognizable brands solve their toughest business challenges and evolve to meet the demands of today's digital economy.
By channeling the power of all, we make ordinary customer and employee experiences extraordinary. Our people \\[CSGers] are fearlessly committed and connected, high on integrity and low on ego, making us the easiest company to do business with and the best place to work. We power a culture of integrity, innovation, and impact across our locations, representing the most authentic version of ourselves to build a better future together. That's just who we are. Learn more about CSG Inclusion \\& Impact here.

title: Product Manager
description:

title: Data Engineer Infrastructure
description:

* Excellent communication and teamwork skills, with the ability to work collaboratively in a cross\\-functional environment.

title: QA Tester
description:
**Join the revolution in hospitality tech!**

 **Liven** is a leading global data, technology, and customer experience provider for the hospitality industry. From humble beginnings, we have grown to serve over 6,000 venues and millions of diners across Australia, the USA, and Southeast Asia, processing over 120 million transactions worth more than $3 billion (AUD) annually.

  

At **Liven**, our platform is built to help hospitality businesses **save more and work smarter** by seamlessly integrating every aspect of their operations — from **ordering and payments** to **back\\-of\\-house management**.

  

Driven by a deep passion for the hospitality industry, we continuously innovate to elevate the experience for both venues and their guests. Our solutions are powered by **AI\\-enriched insights** and **automated workflows**, enabling smarter decision\\-making and smoother operations at scale.

  

We’re proud to be an **AI\\-first organisation**. By automating repetitive tasks, we free up space for our teams — and our customers — to focus on what truly matters: solving complex problems, delighting guests, and driving meaningful growth.  

  

**Key Milestones:**

* **Expansion:** Acquired OrderUp, Abacus, Zeemart, Copper and Nomnie forming Asia Pacific’s largest end\\-to\\-end group in hospitality technology.
* **Global Reach:** Headquartered across major cities including Melbourne, Brisbane, Sydney, Singapore, Bali, Jakarta, New York, and India.


If you're someone who thrives on creativity, bold thinking, and using technology to make things better, faster, and smarter — you’ll feel right at home here.

 **Here’s a quick glimpse of Liven:**

* You can visit Career
* You can visit LinkedIn
* You can Visit Blog
* Acquisition News

**About the role**
------------------


As a **QA Tester** at Liven, you’ll be the guardian of quality across our platform. You’ll work closely with developers, product managers, and designers to ensure our releases are stable, reliable, and deliver seamless experiences to our customers. This role focuses primarily on manual testing, with opportunities to contribute to test process improvements, exploratory testing, and collaboration with SDETs on automation initiatives. You’ll play a key part in shaping quality practices across the development lifecycle and advocating for excellence at every stage

**What you'll do**
------------------

* **Manual Testing:** Design, maintain, and execute detailed test cases for web and mobile applications.
* **Exploratory Testing:** Investigate new features and complex workflows, identifying edge cases and potential issues.
* **Regression Testing:** Validate core user journeys and ensure stability across releases.
* **Defect Management:** Log, track, and verify issues in collaboration with development teams.
* **Collaboration:** Partner with engineers and product teams to ensure features are built with quality in mind.
* **Process Improvement:** Contribute to QA documentation, standards, and continuous improvement initiatives.
* **Automation Collaboration:** Work alongside SDETs to identify test cases for automation and ensure coverage parity

**Qualifications**
------------------

* **4–6 years** of experience in manual testing or QA roles.
* Strong understanding of QA methodologies, test case design, and defect lifecycle management.
* Experience testing web and/or mobile applications.
* Familiarity with tools like JIRA, TestRail, Postman, or equivalent.
* Basic knowledge of API testing and database validation (SQL).
* Excellent analytical, troubleshooting, and communication skills.
* A proactive, detail\\-oriented mindset with a passion for delivering high\\-quality software

**Good to Have**
----------------

* Exposure to test automation frameworks (e.g., Cypress, Playwright, Jest).
* Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and Git\\-based workflows.
* Experience with performance, usability, or security testing.
* Understanding of containerized or cloud\\-based systems (Docker, AWS, etc.).

title: Field Service Engineer
description:
**Location:**

Jakarta, Jakarta Raya, Indonesia
**Job ID:**

R0109789
**Date Posted:**

2025\\-11\\-03
**Company Name:**

PT. HITACHI SAKTI ENERGY INDONESIA
**Profession (Job Category):**

Engineering \\& Science
**Job Schedule:**

Full time
**Remote:**

No
**Job Description:**

**The opportunity:**

As a Field Service Engineer at Hitachi Energy, you will be responsible for the installation, maintenance, and repair of Hitachi equipment and systems at customer sites. This entry\\-level role provides a foundational opportunity to develop technical expertise and customer service skills within a dynamic engineering environment.


**How you’ll make an impact:**

* You will assist senior field service engineers with the installation, configuration, and commissioning of Hitachi products and systems at various customer locations.
* You will perform routine preventative maintenance and diagnostics on equipment to ensure optimal performance and minimize downtime, troubleshoot and diagnose technical issues with hardware and software components, utilizing diagnostic tools and technical documentation.
* You will execute repairs and replacements of faulty parts, ensure adherence to Hitachi's quality and safety standards, document all service activities, including detailed reports of installations, maintenance performed, and repairs made.
* You will communicate effectively with customers to explain technical issues, solutions, and preventive measures in a clear and professional manner.
* You will participate in ongoing training and development programs to enhance technical knowledge and skills related to Hitachi's product portfolio, adhere to all company policies, safety regulations, and customer site protocols.
* You will provide basic technical support and guidance to customers as needed, maintain a professional appearance and demeanor while representing Hitachi Energy.
* You will be responsible to ensure compliance with applicable external and internal regulations, procedures, and guidelines.
* Living Hitachi Energy's core values of safety and integrity, which means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues and the business.

**Your background:**

* Bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering or a related technical field.
* Strong foundational understanding of electrical and mechanical principles.
* Excellent problem\\-solving and analytical skills with a keen attention to detail. Proficiency in using basic hand tools and diagnostic equipment.
* Ability to read and interpret technical manuals, schematics, and wiring diagrams. Willingness and ability to travel frequently to customer sites, potentially including overnight stays.
* Basic computer literacy, including proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite. Prior internship or co\\-op experience in a technical or field service role is a plus and customer\\-focused attitude with a commitment to delivering high\\-quality service.
* Proficiency in English communication.

**Qualified individuals with a disability may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Hitachi Energy career site as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by completing a** **general inquiry form** **on our website. Please include your contact information and specific details about your required accommodation to support you during the job application process.**

description:

**About Sea Labs Indonesia:**
Sea Labs is at the core of the Sea platforms development, supporting diverse business lines from e\\-commerce, supply chain, games, payment and finance, among many others.
