title: Associate Marketing Campaign Manager, ID
description:
**About Us**Founded in 1999 and listed on NASDAQ in 2003 and HKEX in 2021, Trip.com Group is a leading global travel service provider comprising of Trip.com, Ctrip, Skyscanner, and Qunar.  

  

  

Across its platforms, Trip.com Group integrates travel resources from industry partners and helps travellers worldwide pursue the perfect trip with exceptional travel products and services.  

  

  

We have four Customer Service Centres for Trip.com established in Japan, Korea, the UK, and the Philippines, providing 24/7 customer service in 19 different languages.  

  

  

We have more than 30,000 employees scattered across 30 countries in Asia, Europe, the Americas, and Oceania, striving to expand our global markets and aiming to be the world’s leading and most trusted family of online travel brands that aspire to deliver the perfect trip at the best price for every traveller.  

  

  

**In this Role, you’ll get to*** Develop campaign strategies, executing detailed campaign plans across Trip.com products effectively, on schedule, and on budget to achieve aggressive growth targets.
* Produce high quality campaigns, with localization that on promotional materials to be appealing and fit to Indonesia market.
* In charge of product marketing fit, product grading, ideation of campaign materials, campaign landing page setup, content layout, and copy writing/translation.
* Track, measure each performance with quantitative metrics such as order growth, conversion rate, user growth, ROI in timely performance reporting.
* Collaborate with cross\\-functional teams in local stakeholders and headquarters including flight, hotel, design, content, product team, business analyst, etc.
* Understand Indonesia travel demand, stay up to date with industry trends, and identify new opportunities for Indonesia market growth.
Performing other duties when needed.  
* 
  

**What you'll Need to Succeed*** Minimum Bachelor's degree in marketing, business or a related discipline.
* At least 4 years of proven experience in campaign production \\& execution, preferably with OTA background.
* Deep knowledge of Indonesia market travel trend and competitor landscape.
* Experience in using campaign systems or marketing software.
* Creative, able to formulate and produce dynamic strategies with originality.
* Data\\-driven and strong analytical skills.
* Good in English (written and verbal) to work in multicultural working environments.
Strong project management, organizational, and communication skills. Good teamwork spirit, multitasking and quickly adapting to fast\\-paced environments and the rapid changes in business conditions.  
* 
  

**Why Trip.com Group**We offer a stage to unleash your full potential and drive global impact. As an international team, we embrace an open and inclusive culture that supports and respect team members in and out of the workplace. Everyone is on a trip, whether it's a career trip or a life trip. At Trip.com Group, you can define your own trip by setting a goal and celebrate your success by recognizing the progress you have made.  

  

**What’s more?*** Our rapid business growth in global offers abundant career opportunities at various levels and in multiple functions

title: Financial Analyst – Investment & Strategy Services Company (Abiansemal)
description:
Our client, an Investment \\& Strategy services company located in Abiansemal specialising in high\\-value investment projects, business valuations, and shareholder\\-focused financial modeling, is looking for a Financial Analyst to join their dynamic team immediately.

The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills, experience in financial modeling, and a keen ability to translate complex data into actionable insights. They should be detail\\-oriented, capable of working in a fast\\-paced environment, and motivated to contribute to large\\-scale, impactful projects.

This role involves working closely with the Director of Investment and Strategy to prepare advanced Excel models, business valuations, pitch decks, one\\-pagers, and comprehensive business case documentation.

**Requirements:** 

* Open for local candidates.
* Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or related field.
* Minimum 2\\-3 years’ experience in an accounting firm, investment banking, PE, corporate development, transaction services, or real estate/infra finance.
* Advanced Excel skills: 3\\-statement modeling, dynamic drivers, sensitivity analysis, audit trails.
* Strong valuation expertise: DCF, comps, precedents, LBO/project finance.
* Experience underwriting hospitality/real estate or complex asset projects.
* Excellent communication skills: ability to synthesise financial data into crisp, actionable insights.
* Exposure to carbon markets, energy efficiency, or sustainability (VERs, Gold Standard, LCA).
* Familiarity with Monte Carlo simulations or other advanced scenario methodologies, Python (pandas), or VBA for automation.
* Knowledge of Indonesia’s business/regulatory environment; Bahasa Indonesia language skills.
* Initiative, works efficiently, and delivers results quickly without compromising quality or attention to detail.

**Responsibilities:**

**Financial Modelling \\& Valuation**

* Build and maintain advanced 3\\-statement Excel models with scenario and sensitivity analysis. These are interconnected, auditable and powerful business engines.
* To analyse, structure, and take a position on an investment opportunity by analysing the data correctly to project scenarios, cash flows, assessing risks, and testing assumptions. (ADR, RevPAR, occupancy, GOP margins, capex, ramp, EBITDA, IRR, NPV, NOI, RevPar, CapRate, etc...).
* Perform valuations using DCF, Terminal Value, EBITDA multiples, LBO/project finance, comps, precedent transactions, and value bridges.
* Exit Dynamics: Develop and model a variety of exit strategies to provide investors with clear and compelling options for realising a return. This includes creating detailed projections for scenarios (bear, base, bull), used to validate a strategic sale through financial metrics.
* Standardise modular templates for real estate, Media, Health, M\\&A, infrastructure, and carbon credit projects.
* Run Audits on tools, checks and continuous improvements.

**Business Case Validation \\& Due Diligence**

* Collaborate with internal teams and partners to gather data and validate assumptions.
* Build Educated Forecast models for the next 10 to 15 to 25 years.
* Run due diligence processes (financial, commercial, technical) and maintain data\\-room structure.
* Conduct red\\-flag reviews and articulate risks/mitigants in concise memos.

**Investor Materials \\& Reporting**

* Work together with the Investment Associate to provide them with the content for high\\-quality pitch decks, one\\-pagers, valuation notes, and IC memos.
* Convert analysis into clear, traceable outputs tailored to institutional investors and stakeholders.
* Support shareholder reporting with KPIs, valuation updates, and variance commentary.
* Support stakeholders with updates, reviews and defense of your models.

**Strategic \\& Market Analysis**

* Together with Investment associate complete market research and competitor benchmarking to strengthen business cases.
* Provide actionable insights and recommendations to management and investors.

**Continuous Improvement \\& Tooling**

* Refine models and templates for efficiency, accuracy, and scalability.
* Optional: apply Python/VBA or Monte Carlo tools for automation and advanced risk analysis.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive salary with performance\\-based bonuses linked to investment outcomes.
* Opportunity to work directly with the team on high\\-profile deals.
* Career growth toward Deal Desk Lead and exposure to M\\&A, real estate development, hospitality, wellness and sustainability projects.

Job Type: Full\\-time

title: Consultant as Air Quality Analyst
description:
***Consultant as Air Quality Analyst, Cities Program***

***This is a hybrid position which requires 8 days per month in the office. You will be based in our office in WRI Indonesia, Jakarta. Existing work authorization is required at the time of application submission as WRI is unable to sponsor any visa work sponsorship for this position.***

**Program Overview**

WRI Indonesia is an independent research organization that works with governments, businesses, multilateral institutions and civil society groups to develop practical solutions that improve people’s lives and ensure nature can thrive in Indonesia. We organize our work around five crucial issues: Forest and Land Use, Climate, Energy, Cities and Transportation, and the Ocean. WRI Indonesia’s transport portfolio focus on reducing cities’ GHG emission through shifting to low carbon mobility, vehicle electrification and, in\\-parallel with the energy and climate programs, greening the electricity grid to reach optimum emission reduction. Our mission is to help cities and provinces to implement low carbon development and equitable transport system, particularly in transportation and energy sectors, to achieve economic, social, and environmental goals.  



Air Quality Program


WRI’s air quality program is a global initiative that seeks to identify, build awareness of, and eliminate the root causes of air pollution that damages climate, human, and ecosystem health. The program has three main areas of work: (i) engagement with city stakeholders to use participatory science to diagnose and develop targeted, cost\\-effective clean air solutions to protect human health and climate, (ii) working with the science community to convert innovative methods into tools and products that communities and policymakers can use to better manage their impact on the atmosphere, and (iii) working with national governments and business networks to design and implement broader regional\\-to\\-global air quality governance. It is a part of the WRI Ross Center on Sustainable Cities, with additional oversight from the Data Lab and engagement with Climate, Governance, Energy, and other programs at WRI. The team is global, with senior experts distributed across WRI’s network of international offices.  



Indonesia Freight Decarbonization Accelerator (IFDA)


IFDA is an newly developed platform by WRI Indonesia with the aim to accelerate the transition toward a zero\\-emission freight transport system that supports Indonesia’s net\\-zero emission target. IFDA will serve as a platform for collaboration among policymakers, industry players, suppliers, financial institutions, and civil society organizations (CSOs) to help build a strong ecosystem for Zero Emission Transport (ZET)s and other clean technologies. Through this program, WRI Indonesia will focus on increasing demand for ZETs among major corporations and establishing sub\\-national champions for ZET action plans, while simultaneously working with the national government to strengthen the regulatory framework for ZET implementation.  



**Job Highlight**

The Air Quality Analyst will support urban mobility team by conducting research and analysis on e\\-mobility issues at national and sub\\-national level. This role will focus on producing high quality research products, evidence\\-based policy recommendations, and support the integration of social and economic dimensions into transport transitions through the IFDA program. Additionally, this position will support the project management and engagement activities.  



This position will be based in Jakarta with office\\-flex working arrangement and travel requirement as needed. Reporting directly to the Air Quality Project Manager, this position will be working closely and collaboratively with the urban mobility team. In support of WRI's DEI commitment, you are responsible for actively participating in these collaborative efforts by integrating equity into your work, our workplace, and the organizational culture.  



**What You Will Do**

**Research (50%)**

* Develop robust and unbiased evidence\\-based air quality research products that help quantify air quality co benefits resulting from vehicle decarbonization to inform relevant policymakers and other key stakeholders.
* In coordination with Air Quality Lead and other expert oversee the collection, management and large\\-scale analysis of air quality and transport data from monitoring stations and partners, ensuring data integrity and providing feedback on data analysis to maintain high\\-quality research standards.
* Assist the development of IFDA program in the transport sector.
* Develop the capacity of WRI institutional knowledge on sustainable and inclusive transport, with specific focus on Heavy Duty Vehicle and Freight Transport.
* Familiarize on WRI’s research standard and guidance and support the development of WRI Indonesia knowledge product on sustainable transport and e\\-mobility.

**Stakeholder Engagement (30%)**

* Develop relationship to expand the engagement with policymakers and key stakeholder in national and sub\\-national level.
* Develop and deliver presentations to internal team with manager’s guidance
* Communicate research approach and findings effectively to internal audiences with manager guidance
* Coordinate activities with Government, donors, and partner organizations.

**Project Management (20%)**

* Support in organizing internal and external meetings, workshops, conferences and other implementation activities.
* Support teams in developing communication and knowledge products with manager guidance.
* Contribute to formulating report to funders and donors.

**What You Will Need**

* Bachelor’s Degree in transportation, civil engineering, urban planning, economics, geography or any other related field. Master Degree is preferred.
* Minimum 3 years of full\\-time work experience in transportation field, has strong interest, knowledge, and experience in sustainable transport, e\\-mobility, or power sector topic is preferred.
* Ability to support discrete elements of research projects with manager guidance, e.g. systematically reviewing and synthesizing existing literature; collecting, cleaning, organizing, analyzing and visualizing data.
* Ability to communicate research approach and findings effectively to internal audiences with manager guidance, using compelling presentation skills.
* Highly organized and systematic with strong time management skills and ability to juggle competing priorities and deadlines required.
* Attention to detail and the ability to track, share and visualize relevant information to assist decision making is required.
* Experience in statistical analysis, transport modelling, and scientific writing
* Excellent oral and written communication skills in both Bahasa Indonesia and English
* Ability and willingness to travel as assigned
* Legally able to work in Indonesia

**Performance Standards**

* Work plan and knowledge products are expected to be carried out in timely, satisfactory fashion with minor supervision
* Knowledge products produced show rigorous analytical content.
* Effective teamwork and communication.
* Positively maintained relationship with external and internal stakeholders

**Deliverables**

* Relevant data, references, and analysis result related to Air Quality are provided in a timely and satisfactory manner, in accordance with WRI’s research standards
* Co\\-produce high quality knowledge products (i.e. policy brief, technical guideline, article, op\\-ed, training module/presentation, working paper, report) according to WRI standard, published, and properly disseminated to targeted audience in a timely manner.
* Workshops/trainings conducted to targeted audience\\-based project workplan.
* Reports (or any other written deliverables/outcomes) are submitted in a timely manner
* Monthly consolidated reports on work progress and achievements

**Duration**

This position is required to join as soon as possible with initial contract period up to 31 July 2026\\.  



**Terms of Payment**

Daily rate\\-based consultant with a maximum of 18 (eighteen) working days per month.  



**How to Apply:**

* Please submit a resume with a cover letter by **26 November 2025** . You must apply through the WRI Careers portal to be considered. We may close for applications sooner if we receive a high volume of applications from qualified candidates.
* Must have authorization to work in Indonesia to be eligible for this position.
* Final candidates might be required to take a certain test and/or to produce/share writing samples when needed.
* This is a locally engaged position, Indonesian nationals are encouraged to apply.

**What we offer:**

* Consultant rate that is commensurate with experience and skill.
* Travel insurance for both domestic and international for any travel duty as assigned by WRI Indonesia
* Access to the WRI global network with the opportunity to exchange with and learn from passionate colleagues working at the cutting edge of their fields.
* A workplace that strives to put diversity and inclusion at the heart of our work
* The opportunity to join and get involved in different working groups and affinity groups to shape the future of WRI
* Commitment to hybrid working model with flexible working hours

**About Us:**

World Resources Institute works to improve people’s lives, protect and restore nature and stabilize the climate. As an independent research organization, we leverage our data, expertise and global reach to influence policy and catalyze change across systems like food, land and water; energy; and cities. Our 2,000\\+ staff work on the ground in more than a dozen focus countries and with partners in over 50 nations.


**Our mission and values:**

WRI’s mission is to move human society to live in ways that protect Earth’s environment and its capacity to provide for the needs and aspirations of current and future generations.


Our values are shared ideals that bind us together: Independence, Integrity, Impact, Partnership, and Care.


**Our culture:**

WRI is committed to advancing gender and social equity for human well\\-being in our mission including equal opportunities in employment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, religion, sex, national origin, age, caste, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, or protected Veteran status.


Our Human Resources Team carefully reviews all applications.

title: Plant Finance Analyst
description:
As Plant Finance Analyst, you will be responsible for delivering accurate financial forecasts (Monthly Operation Review, Annual Operating Plan) and analyzing plant performance, including variances between actual and forecasted results. You will provide financial insights and cost analysis to support local plant teams and assists in cost studies and business case preparation.  



  

**What You'll Do**

* You will provide accurate financial estimates: Annual Operating Plan (AOP Plant \\& Consumer/Commercial), Rolling forecast (1\\+11, 2\\+10, etc.), intercompany selling price
* You will analyze actual financial results against Annual Operating Plan and forecast.
* You will be responsible for timely and accurate financial reporting (Monthly Operation Review and other financial reports for local and regional management, monthly, bi\\-yearly and yearly).
* You will provide support to other function/department by providing financial data and analysis and actively participate in continuous improvement project related to finance process and system.

  

**What We're Looking For**

* You have minimum 3 years relevant experience at Finance in manufacturing environment
* You have knowledge of accounting and understanding of Financial Statements (Balance Sheet, P\\&L and Cash Flow)
* You have knowledge, understanding, and practical skills in relevant systems (i.e. SAP, Excel, Hyperion or similar application)

**What Will Set You Apart**

* You have knowledge in PowerBI and Tableau
* You are able to analyze and grasp a situation quickly from different perspectives.
* You are highly organized and has ability to manage deadlines and multiple priorities.
* You are able to present ideas and complex, technical information clearly through effective communications skills.
* You demonstrate ethical and moral behavior and unquestionable integrity and character.
* You are self motivated, receives satisfaction from finishing work and from getting good result.

description:

At DHL, people mean the world to us. That’s why our goal has always been to attract and retain the best talent over the world. We recognize the difference you bring to our business, and together we share the pride of building The logistics company for the world. title: MEL and Data Assistant– Indonesia
description:
**MEL and Data Assistant– Indonesia,** **BRAC Ultra\\-Poor Graduation Initiative**

**About the Opportunity**


BRAC’s Ultra Poor Graduation Initiative (UPGI) is dedicated to scaling up the Graduation approach globally, empowering the world’s poorest to achieve sustainable livelihoods and overcome extreme poverty. We are seeking a qualified national candidate based in Indonesia, to support all aspects of operations and administration processes to deliver the UPGI scale\\-up strategy. This position requires close collaboration with staff in Jakarta and 6 other provinces in Indonesia, namely West Sumatera, West Java, Yogyakarta, East Java, East Nusa Tenggara, and West Nusa Tenggara.



UPGI is looking for a MEL and Data Assistant to join our dynamic team. The successful candidate will assist UPGI’s Senior MEL and Research Analyst for aspects of the project relating to MEL and data management, analysis and reporting.

  


**About BRAC and the Ultra\\-Poor Graduation Initiative**



BRAC is the world’s largest Global South\\-led international non\\-governmental development organization, with the vision of a world free from all forms of exploitation and discrimination, where everyone has the opportunity to realize their potential. BRAC is a leader in developing and implementing cost\\-effective, evidence\\-based programs to assist impoverished and marginalized communities in low\\-income countries. It is an organization of and for the people of the Global South, pioneering new development and social enterprise approaches to equip communities to achieve prosperity.


BRAC was founded in Bangladesh in 1972 by Sir Fazle Hasan Abed. As of today, BRAC has reached more than 100 million people and works in 16 different countries across Africa and Asia. BRAC has a holistic approach to development that uses a wide array of programs that include microfinance, education, health, agriculture, gender, and human rights. BRAC invests in communities’ own human and material resources, catalyzing lasting change and creating an ecosystem in which the poor have the chance to seize control of their own lives.



The **Ultra\\-Poor Graduation Initiative** is a global unit within BRAC International that was founded in 2016 to build off the success of BRAC’s Ultra\\-Poor Graduation program in Bangladesh. Graduation is an evidence\\-based, scalable intervention proven to break the poverty trap for the long term. To help eradicate extreme poverty, BRAC UPGI is working to scale globally by integrating Graduation into existing government programs and help 21 million more people lift themselves from extreme poverty by 2026\\. At present UPGI has interventions with governments in South Africa, Rwanda, India, Indonesia, the Philippines, and India.

  




**Primary Responsibilities**



* Assist in the design and implementation of data collection tools and methodologies specific to the Graduation programming, conduct field visits to collect primary data through surveys, spot\\-check, interviews, and focus group discussions with program participants, manage and maintain a comprehensive database of program data, ensuring data accuracy and confidentiality.


* Assist in the analysis of quantitative and qualitative data to measure program outcomes and impacts, prepare data visualizations, including charts and graphs, to effectively communicate findings.


* Assist the preparation of regular reports on program progress and impact for internal and external stakeholders, assist in the development of case studies, success stories, and other documentation to showcase program achievements, ensure timely and accurate submission of MEL requirements document as per donor and organizational requirements.


* Participate in the development and refinement of MEL frameworks and plans for the Graduation programming, monitor and evaluate program activities to ensure alignment with project goals and objectives, support learning activities, including workshops and knowledge\\-sharing sessions, to promote best practices in MEL.


* Assist in maintaining MEL documentation and records, including data entry and filing, provide administrative support to the MEL team and program staff as needed.


**Other (Safeguarding Responsibilities)**


* Ensure the safety of team members from any harm, abuse, neglect, harassment, and exploitation to achieve the program’s goals of safeguarding implementation.


* Practice, promote and endorse the issues of safeguarding policy among team members and ensure the implementation of safeguarding standards in every course of action.


* Follow the safeguarding reporting procedure in case any reportable incident takes place, and encourage others to do so.

  



**Qualifications**



* Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field such as social sciences, statistics, economics, development studies, or a related discipline.


* Minimum of 3 years of experience in monitoring and evaluation, data analysis, or a related field, preferably within development programs focused on poverty alleviation or livelihoods.


* Experience with data collection and analysis tools such as Excel or other statistical software.


* Strong analytical and problem\\-solving skills.


* Proficiency in data management and analysis


* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.


* Detail\\-oriented with strong organizational skills.


* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.


* Knowledge of MEL frameworks and methodologies, especially in the context of poverty reduction program.


* Ability to handle multiple tasks and meet deadlines.


* Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work with diverse teams and communities.

  



**How to Apply**



**This is an outstanding opportunity to support a highly effective, collaborative, and innovative non\\-profit. title: Senior Risk Analyst - Operational Risk Management
description:
**Who we are is what we do.**


Deel is the all\\-in\\-one payroll and HR platform for global teams. Our vision is to unlock global opportunity for every person, team, and business. Built for the way the world works today, Deel combines HRIS, payroll, compliance, benefits, performance, and equipment management into one seamless platform. With AI\\-powered tools and a fully owned payroll infrastructure, Deel supports every worker type in 150\\+ countries—helping businesses scale smarter, faster, and more compliantly.


Among the largest globally distributed companies in the world, our team of 7,000 spans more than 100 countries, speaks 74 languages, and brings a connected and dynamic culture that drives continuous learning and innovation for our customers.

**Why should you be part of our success story?**


As the fastest\\-growing Software as a Service (SaaS) company in history, Deel is transforming how global talent connects with world\\-class companies – breaking down borders that have traditionally limited both hiring and career opportunities. We're not just building software; we're creating the infrastructure for the future of work, enabling a more diverse and inclusive global economy. In 2024 alone, we paid $11\\.2 billion to workers in nearly 100 currencies and provided healthcare and benefits to workers in 109 countries—ensuring people get paid and protected, no matter where they are.


Our momentum is reflected in our achievements and customer satisfaction: CNBC Disruptor 50, Forbes Cloud 100, Deloitte Fast 500, and repeated recognition on Y Combinator’s top companies list – all while maintaining a 4\\.83 average rating from 15,000 reviews across G2, Trustpilot, Captera, Apple and Google.


Your experience at Deel will be a career accelerator. At the forefront of the global work revolution, you'll tackle complex challenges that impact millions of people's working lives. With our momentum—backed by a $17\\.3 billion valuation and $1 B in Annual Recurring Revenue (ARR) in just over five years—you'll drive meaningful impact while building expertise that makes you a sought\\-after leader in the transformation of global work.

**Summary**


The Senior ORM Risk Analyst will play a key role in strengthening and embedding the Operational Risk Management Framework (ORMF), providing independent challenge, driving high\\-quality analysis, and taking partial ownership of ORM programs. Working closely with the Operational Risk team, this role contributes to effective risk reporting, governance, and the continuous improvement of operational risk practices across the organisation.

**Responsibilities**

* Conduct detailed risk assessments for technology, process, and organizational change initiatives across the business.
* Evaluate the potential impact of changes on operational resilience, regulatory compliance, customer experience, and financial stability.
* Ensure risk assessments are integrated early in the change lifecycle to proactively mitigate issues.
* Support the establishment and operation of change governance frameworks, policies, and approval processes.
* Review and challenge change proposals, project documentation, and impact assessments to ensure compliance with internal standards and regulatory expectations.
* Track adherence to change risk governance requirements, escalating deviations where necessary.
* Monitor key risk indicators (KRIs) and metrics to evaluate the effectiveness of change\\-related controls.
* Perform post\\-implementation reviews to validate that risks were appropriately mitigated and controls are operating effectively. Recommend corrective actions and strengthen governance practices where gaps are identified
* Produce high\\-quality operational risk dashboards, trend analysis, and committee reporting.
* Provide insights on risk exposures, themes, and emerging risks to senior management.
* Promote a strong risk culture by providing training, coaching, and regular engagement with stakeholders.
* Encourage proactive identification and escalation of risks.

**Qualifications**

* A minimum of 7 years of experience in operational risk management, audit, or related roles within financial services, payments, or FinTech.
* Strong working knowledge of ORM programs, experience required in Change Risk Management and/or Change Governance
* Experience with GRC systems and risk reporting tools.
* Strong analytical and problem\\-solving skills with attention to detail.
* Confident facilitator with ability to engage and challenge stakeholders at all levels.
* Bachelor’s degree in Risk Management, Finance, Business, or related field.
* Professional certifications (e.g., ORM, CRISC, FRM) strongly preferred.

**Total Rewards**


Our workforce deserves fair and competitive pay that meets them where they are. With scalable benefits, rewards, and perks, our total rewards programs reflect our commitment to inclusivity and access for all.

**Some things you’ll enjoy**

* Stock grant opportunities dependent on your role, employment status and location
* Additional perks and benefits based on your employment status and country
* The flexibility of remote work, including optional WeWork access


At Deel, we’re an equal\\-opportunity employer that values diversity and positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of race, religion, sex, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, pregnancy or maternity or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

*Unless otherwise agreed, we will communicate with job applicants using Deel\\-specific emails, which include @**deel.com* *and other acquired company emails like @**payspace.com* *and @**paygroup.com**. You can view the most up\\-to\\-date job listings at Deel by visiting* *our careers page**.*  

  

*Deel is an equal\\-opportunity employer and is committed to cultivating a diverse and inclusive workplace that reflects different abilities, backgrounds, beliefs, experiences, identities and perspectives.*  

  

*Deel will provide accommodations on request throughout the recruitment, selection and assessment process for applicants with disabilities. If you require accommodations, please inform our Talent Acquisition Team* *via this link* *and a team member will be in touch to ensure your equal participation. If you have difficulty accessing the form, please email at recruiting@deel.com.*

title: Accountant
description:
**Career Area:**


Finance**Job Description:**

**Your Work Shapes the World at Caterpillar Inc.**

When you join Caterpillar, you're joining a global team who cares not just about the work we do – but also about each other. We are the makers, problem solvers, and future world builders who are creating stronger, more sustainable communities. We don't just talk about progress and innovation here – we make it happen, with our customers, where we work and live. Together, we are building a better world, so we can all enjoy living in it.

**Job Summary**  

Provides timely and accurate financial record keeping and reporting as directed by management with limited supervision.

**What You Will Do**

* Maintaining financial records in accordance with GAAP and organizational standards.
* Creating reports on financial performance for internal and external use.
* Performing balance sheet and P\\&L reconciliations.
* Creating and utilizing automated tools for the updating, analyzing and reporting of consolidated financial results.

**What You Have**

**Accuracy and Attention to Detail**: Understanding the necessity and value of accuracy; ability to complete tasks with high levels of precision.

* Processes large quantities of detailed information with high levels of accuracy.
* Productively balances speed and accuracy.
* Implements a variety of cross\\-checking approaches and mechanisms.
* Demonstrates expertise in quality assurance tools, techniques, and standards.

**Analytical Thinking**: Knowledge of techniques and tools that promote effective analysis; ability to determine the root cause of organizational problems and create alternative solutions that resolve these problems.

* Approaches a situation or problem by defining the problem or issue and determining its significance.
* Makes a systematic comparison of two or more alternative solutions.
* Uses logic and intuition to make inferences about the meaning of the data and arrive at conclusions.
* Identifies the major forces, events, and people impacting and impacted by the situation at hand.

**Effective Communications**: Understanding of effective communication concepts, tools and techniques; ability to effectively transmit, receive, and accurately interpret ideas, information, and needs through the application of appropriate communication behaviors.

* Delivers helpful feedback that focuses on behaviors without offending the recipient.
* Listens to feedback without defensiveness and uses it for own communication effectiveness.
* Makes oral presentations and writes reports needed for own work.
* Looks for and considers non\\-verbal cues from individuals and groups.

**Managing Multiple Priorities**: Knowledge of effective self\\-management practices; ability to manage multiple concurrent objectives, projects, groups, or activities, making effective judgments as to prioritizing and time allocation.

* Recognizes changing demands and priorities; validates changes with management.
* Obtains information about how current assignments contribute to organizational goals.
* Completes current work according to assigned priorities.
* Responds to day\\-to\\-day operational priorities while still making progress on project work.
* Performs at least 2\\-3 concurrent activities without reducing productivity.

**Accounting**: Knowledge of accounting methods, processes, and tools; ability to maintain and prepare financial statements and reports using accounting methods and processes.

* Utilizes cost monitoring practices, techniques and considerations.
* Works with financial transactions and related documentation within the organization.
* Participates in accounting practices of classifying and recording financial data.
* Follows regulations for entering and reporting the financial content in major accounting systems.

**Financial Analysis**: Knowledge of tools and approaches of financial analysis; ability to read, interpret and draw accurate conclusions from financial and numerical material.

* Describes the concepts behind financial analysis and implications of financial data.
* Explains how financial statements are organized and the type of information they provide.
* Identifies major types of financial statements issued by the organization.
* Lists activities and responsibilities of financial analysts.

**Financial Record Keeping**: Knowledge of financial record keeping processes, methods, and tools; ability to maintain accurate and thorough records of financial transactions.

* Implements organizational standards for financial record keeping.
* Analyzes and documents errors or inaccuracies in financial records.
* Supplies financial data that is used in reports.
* Uses basic tools to record accurate and timely financial data.

**Financial Reporting**: Knowledge of processes, methods, and tools of financial reporting; ability to create and maintain accurate and thorough financial reports.

* Follows organizational practices and guidelines for product profitability reporting.
* Analyzes errors or inaccuracies in financial reports.
* Monitors compliance with organizational standards for financial report writing.
* Implements organizational methods and procedures for financial report writing.

**Top Candidates Also Have**

* Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or Tax Administration, preferably with additional certifications in Accounting (e.g. CA/ CPA).
* Mandatory Certification: Brevet A \\& B
* Trained in US GAAP
* Business knowledge skills (have worked as an auditor, specifically auditing financial institutions or prior employment at a banking or financial company)
* Regulatory Reporting: Hands\\-on experience with OJK (Otoritas Jasa Keuangan)/Financial Services Authority reporting
* Tax Compliance Knowledge: Transfer Pricing documentation, local tax regulations.

**Additional Info**

* Work location: Jakarta
* This position requires **working onsite five days a week**.

**Final Details**


Caterpillar is not currently hiring individuals for this position who now or in the future require sponsorship for employment visa status; however, as a global company, Caterpillar offers many job opportunities outside of Singapore which can be found through our employment website at www.caterpillar.com/careers.

**About Caterpillar**


Caterpillar Inc. is the world’s leading manufacturer of construction and mining equipment, off\\-highway diesel and natural gas engines, industrial gas turbines and diesel\\-electric locomotives. For nearly 100 years, we’ve been helping customers build a better, more sustainable world and are committed and contributing to a reduced\\-carbon future. Our innovative products and services, backed by our global dealer network, provide exceptional value that helps customers succeed.


**Posting Dates:**


November 11, 2025 \\- November 24, 2025
Caterpillar is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants of any age are encouraged to apply


Not ready to apply? Join our Talent Community.

title: Supply Analyst
description:
**About the Role**  

Become a key player in scaling the GoMart business to new heights! As a Supply Analyst, you'll be at the heart of our dynamic growth, reporting to key stakeholders, and collaborating with business and operations teams to build amazing supply reliability for our beloved customer.
If you have a passion for analytics and a drive to innovate, we want you on our team! Apply now and be part of our cutting\\-edge journey, shaping the future of the grocery industry in Indonesia!
### **What You Will Do**

* + Gather and analyze data from various sources to identify trends, patterns, insights that drive business decisions and translate data insight into improvement initiatives
	+ Develop dashboards and reports using tools such as Quick BI, Tableau, Excel to support Stakeholders present complex data in clear and actionable formats
	+ Collaborate with the data science team, product managers, business team, to understand their data requirements and translate thme into analytical requirements
	+ Implement monitoring and continuous improvement of content and merchandising management

### **What You Will Need**

* + At least 5 years working experience in a data \\& analytical role
	+ Strong analytical thinking, insights generating, and complex problem\\-solving skills using various improvement tools and methods, including SQL Tools eg: QuickBI,MaxCompute is a must
	+ Effective communication skills with the ability to present insight and information clearly and concisely
	+ Strong business acumen with a data\\-driven approach to problem\\-solving and the ability to drive initiatives independently.
	+ A confident communicator in verbal and written English

**About the Team**  

At the Groceries product group, we're revolutionizing how people get their daily staples with our lightning\\-fast, on\\-demand delivery service. GoMart, our flagship B2C online grocery platform, has skyrocketed, leading the quick commerce market and delivering convenience items to delighted consumers in over 100 cities across Indonesia. Our mission is to empower merchant partners nationwide, helping them thrive while ensuring our customers receive their daily essentials swiftly and reliably.
Join us on this thrilling journey to shape the future of the independent movement for everyone and everything. We're a diverse team that values curiosity, a passion for technology, and a collaborative spirit. If you're driven by innovation and excited about solving real\\-world problems with cutting\\-edge tech, we want you to be on our team. Let's create the future together! **About GoTo Group**
GoTo Group is the largest digital ecosystem in Indonesia with its mission to “Empower Progress’ by offering technological infrastructure and solutions for everyone to access and thrive in the digital economy. The GoTo ecosystem consists of on\\-demand transportation services, food and grocery delivery, logistics and fulfillment, as well as financial and payment services through the Gojek and GoTo Financial platforms.It is the first platform in Southeast Asia that hosts these crucial cases in a single ecosystem, capturing the majority of Indonesia’s vast consumer household. **About Gojek**
Gojek is Southeast Asia’s leading on\\-demand platform and pioneer of the multi\\-service ecosystem with over 2\\.5 million driver partners across the regions offering a wide range of services such as transportation, food delivery, logistics and more. With its mission to create impact at scale, Gojek is committed to resolving consumer problems and raising standards of living by connecting consumers to the best providers of goods and services in the market. **About GoTo Financial**
GoTo Financial accelerates financial inclusion through its leading financial services and merchants solutions. Its consumer services include GoPay and GoPayLater and serve businesses of all sizes through Midtrans, Moka, GoBiz Plus, GoBiz, and Selly. With its trusted and inclusive ecosystem of products, GoTo Financial is open to new growth opportunities and aims to empower everyone to Make It Happen, Make It Together, Make It Last. *GoTo and its business units, including Gojek and GoToFinancial ("GoTo") only post job opportunities on our official channels on our respective company websites and on LinkedIn. GoTo is not liable for any job postings or job offers that did not originate from us. You should conduct your own due diligence to prevent being victims of any fake job scams, if they did not originate from GoTo's official recruitment channels.* *\\#LI\\-ONSITE*
We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. If you would like more information about how your data is processed, please contact us.

title: Customs Classification Analyst
description:
**BE A PART OF A REVOLUTIONARY CHANGE!**

  

At PMI, we’ve chosen to do something incredible. We’re totally transforming our business and building our future on one clear purpose – to deliver a smoke\\-free future.

  

With huge change, comes huge opportunity. So, wherever you join us, you’ll enjoy the freedom to dream up and deliver better, brighter solutions and the space to move your career forward in endlessly different directions.

  

We are currently seeking talented, business\\-savvy professionals to join **Customs Classification Analyst** based in **Jakarta**. This position will present you with outstanding professional challenges, diverse learning opportunities and career growth.

 **Customs Classification Analyst** is responsible for ensuring accurate product classification in compliance with global and local customs regulations. This role requires strong analytical skills, attention to detail, and collaboration across multiple functions to support trade compliance and operational efficiency.

 **YOUR ‘DAY TO DAY’**

* Analyze and assign Harmonized System (HS) codes for finished goods, equipment, raw materials, and non\\-production items in PMI according to the applicable jurisdictions.
* Interpret and apply international, local customs regulations, judicial rulings, and official decisions to ensure correct classification of products.
* Prepare and maintain detailed records of classification decisions and related government agency determinations to support audits and respond to inquiries from customs authorities, customers, or suppliers.
* Accurately input classification data and government agency determinations into internal systems such as Tax Portal 2\\.0 and SAP.
* Communicate classification decisions clearly to key stakeholders, including Trade Compliance, Logistics, Sales, Project Managers, and cross\\-functional leaders.
* Provide guidance to internal teams and external partners on day\\-to\\-day classification matters.
* Assist in internal export compliance audits, risk assessments, and contribute to process improvement initiatives to strengthen trade compliance programs.

 **WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?**

* Min. Bachelor’s degree, preferably in international Trade, Supply Chain management, Business Administration, Finance, or related field
* Between 3–5 years of experience in Finance, Indirect Tax of customs, Supply Chain area within International Logistics and Foreign Trade Compliance with International and Local Laws and regulations related to Logistics/Trade
* Proficiency in SAP, Excel, MS Office, and trade compliance systems is highly desirable.
* Strong analytical and problem\\-solving skills with attention to detail, and Excellent communication ability both oral and written business English are required.
* Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and influence cross\\-functional decisions.
* Comfortable with technology and digitalization trends, including AI tools, automation, and process optimization
* Willing to be located in Jakarta/Surabaya, preferably Jakarta

 **WHAT WE OFFER**


Our success depends on our talented employees who come to work here every single day with a sense of purpose and an appetite for progress. Join PMI and you too can:

* Seize the freedom to define your future and ours. We’ll empower you to take risks, experiment and explore.
* Be part of an inclusive, diverse culture, where everyone’s contribution is respected; collaborate with some of the world’s best people and feel like you belong.
* Pursue your ambitions and develop your skills with a global business – our staggering size and scale provides endless opportunities to progress.
* Take pride in delivering our promise to society: to deliver a smoke\\-free future


To join our growing team…

title: Senior Analyst/Assistant Manager, Regional Controllership (LATAM)
description:
### **About Team**


You will be part of Sea’s HQ Finance department, which plays an integral role in supporting the accounting and finance needs of our three core businesses (Garena, Shopee, Monee) and across our diverse regional market presence. Within the department, the Regional Controllership function partners with both local and HQ finance teams to enhance the quality, consistency, and accuracy of financial processes and reporting across the Group, adapting to evolving business needs. You will play a key role in bridging HQ finance and respective country finance teams through leading and rolling out crucial projects and new developments.### **Job Description**

* Collaborate with country finance teams to roll out crucial projects and new developments.
* Provide guidance to local finance team to ensure smooth month\\-end closing, accuracy of system data and any accounting related matters
* Liaise and direct the preparation of annual budget and periodic forecast exercises
* Manage crucial projects and other group level initiatives while managing stakeholders from diverse backgrounds
* Drive continuous improvement initiatives, potential finance and tax risks and propose feasible solutions to the team
* Any other tasks and projects assigned
### **Requirements**

* Bachelor’s degree in Finance/ Accounting/ related discipline or other related professional qualification in accounting, such as Chartered Accountant and ACCA
* Minimum 4 years of relevant full\\-time working experience in Finance related roles
* Big 4 accounting firm experience would be a plus
* Strong team player who thrives on excellence and continuous improvement
* Passionate in the finance space and loves to challenge the status quo
* Enjoys working in a fast\\-paced and demanding environment while delivering desired results
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills to engage stakeholders from diverse backgrounds
* Strong logical and analytical thinking skills with attention to detail and accuracy
* Proficient in Microsoft Excel
* Willing to travel to local market within LATAM for business trips

*\\#LI\\-AP1*

title: Business Analyst Intern
description:
About the position:
We are seeking a highly motivated and analytical Business Analyst Intern to join our MSME Team.
This is a unique role that combines business analysis with hands\\-on experience in Artificial Intelligence (AI).
The intern will play a critical dual role:* AI Focus: You will be directly responsible for training and refining a new AI Agent, which is a key strategic project for the division. This involves preparing, labeling, and validating data to improve the agent's accuracy and performance.
* BA Focus: You will support the MSME team with core business analyst task, including data analysis, process mapping, requirements gathering, including improving business process using AI to help us better serve our MSME clients.


This position is ideal for a proactive learner who is passionate about technology, data, and problem\\-solving, and is eager to see the direct impact to their work.
### **Responsibilities:**

* **AI Agent Training:**
* Prepare, cleanse, and label datasets used for training the AI Agent.
* Perfrom quality assurance on data to ensure high accuracy.
* Monitor the AI Agent's performance, identify inaccuracies or biases, and provide iterative feedback to the development team.
* Document the training processes and data standards.
* **Business Analysis:**
* Assist in gathering, analyzing, and documenting business requirements from stakeholders within the MSME division.
* Analyze data related to MSME products or client behavior to identify trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
* Help map existing business processes and identify opportunities for improvement.
* Support the team with ad\\-hoc analysis and project coordination tasks as needed.

### **Requirements:**

* Currently pursuing or recently completed a Bachelor's Degree in a Business Information Systems, Computer Science, Statistics, economics, Engineering, or a related field.
* Strong analytical and quantitative problem\\-solving skills.
* Exceptional attention to detail (crucial for the AI data training).
* Proficiency in Microsoft Excel for data analysis.
* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
* A quick learner with a strong sense of curiosity and the ability to work independently.
* A Logical mindset with genuine interest in technology, AI, and business processes.

### **Bonus point if:**

* Have a foundational understanding of AI, Machine Learning, or Natural Language Processing (NLP) concepts.
* Have any prior experience with data labeling, data annotation, or data quality assurance.
* Have familiarity with banking sector in Indonesia



We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. If you would like more information about how your data is processed, please contact us.

title: Project Manager
description:
Job Function: Software \\& Cloud The role:

Are you passionate about delivering complex IT projects on time and within budget? Are you ready to drive customer satisfaction and business value through structured project management?  

Join SoftwareOne’s Project Management team, where you’ll work alongside architects, consultants, analysts, and specialists to deliver high\\-quality solutions for our clients. Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders, including customers and vendor partners, to ensure project excellence.  

As a Project Manager at SoftwareOne, you will lead and support customer engagements, ensuring projects meet scope, timeline, budget, and quality expectations. You will manage projects aligned to the SoftwareOne Project Delivery Framework (pmOne) and the agreed delivery methodology, coordinating all aspects of project delivery and acting as the main point of contact for clients and internal teams. **Key Responsibilities*** Plan, organize, and manage all aspects of assigned projects, ensuring delivery within agreed time, cost, and quality thresholds.
* Lead and support project teams, facilitating resource allocation, regular meetings, and effective communication.
* Develop and maintain project documentation, including status reports, risk logs, and project artefacts.
* Manage project budgets and control costs to ensure financially healthy outcomes.
* Build and maintain strong client relationships, resolving conflicts and ensuring customer satisfaction.
* Identify and develop new opportunities within current projects, supporting early qualification and opportunity assessment.
* Promote knowledge sharing and continuous improvement within the project management community.


What we need to see from you:
* Experience in project management, preferably delivering complex IT solutions in a consulting environment.
* Strong leadership, communication, and stakeholder management skills.
* Proven ability to plan, execute, and deliver projects using structured methodologies (e.g., pmOne, PMP, Prince2, Agile, SCRUM).
* Excellent problem\\-solving, negotiation, and conflict resolution abilities.
* Proficiency with project management tools (e.g., Microsoft Project, PSA, ServiceNow, CRM systems).
* Highly organized, detail\\-oriented, and able to manage multiple priorities in a fast\\-paced environment.
* Strong business acumen and ability to drive process improvement and change management.


Why SoftwareOne?:  

SoftwareOne and Crayon have come together to form a global, AI\\-powered software and cloud solutions provider with a bold vision for the future. With a footprint in over 70 countries and a diverse team of 13,000\\+ professionals, we offer unparalleled opportunities for talent to grow, make an impact, and shape the future of technology. At the heart of our business is our people. We empower our teams to work across borders, innovate fearlessly, and continuously develop their skills through world\\-class learning and development programs. Whether you're passionate about cloud, software, data, AI, or building meaningful client relationships, you’ll find a place to thrive here. Join us and be part of a purpose\\-driven culture where your ideas matter, your growth is supported, and your career can go global.
Accommodations:

SoftwareOne welcomes applicants from all backgrounds and abilities to apply. If you require reasonable adjustments at any point during the recruitment process, email us at reasonable.accommodations@softwareone.com.
Please include the role for which you are applying and your country location. Someone from our organization that is not part of the decision\\-making process will be in touch to discuss your specific needs and we will make every effort to accommodate you. Any information shared will be stored securely and treated in the strictest of confidence in line with GDPR.  

At SoftwareOne, we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and teammates without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. Additionally, we encourage experienced individuals that have taken an intentional career break and are now prepared to return to work to explore our SOAR program.

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
The Senior Data Scientist role presents a strategic opportunity to drive innovation and data\\-driven decision\\-making across the organization. This position is pivotal in transforming complex data into actionable insights, enabling smarter business strategies and enhancing customer experiences. By leveraging advanced analytics, machine learning, and AI technologies, the successful candidate will contribute to the development of scalable solutions that align with our mission of delivering ethical, efficient, and personalized financial services.


This role is critical for enabling scalable analytics, machine learning workflows, and data\\-driven decision\\-making across the organization. You will collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and product teams to ensure data quality, accessibility, and reliability.


**Position Responsibilities:**

* Collaborate with Data engineers and IT Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) to understand source data and utilize large datasets to prepare and optimize data for building Generative AI solutions using Open AI services to enhance our products and services and scaling it globally.
* Develop and implement advanced machine learning models to address complex business challenges, leveraging various algorithms and techniques, with a specific emphasis on utilizing Open AI services for building Generative AI solutions.
* Work closely with partners to gather requirements, design data models, and implement tailored solutions.
* Standardize processes, techniques, and tools into best practices for other data scientists.
* Drive the adoption of data and AI driven solutions by influencing and partnering with key stakeholders.
* Innovate and explore creative methods to source and utilize structured and unstructured data for building data and AI driven solutions. Stay updated on industry trends and advancements in AI/ML, with a specific focus on leveraging OpenAI services to continuously enhance our products and services and scaling efforts.

**Required Qualifications:**

* An advanced degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Statistics, or another quantitative field.
* Minimum of 5 years of experience utilizing data science to solve high\\-impact business problems, with a specific recent focus on building Generative AI applications. (Banking,Insurance,Fintech/Financial services preferred but not limited)
* Proficiency in statistical analysis, machine learning, and data manipulation techniques, particularly in the context of understanding customers and scaling globally.
* Strong programming skills in languages such as Python, R, or SQL, with experience in prompt engineering and relevant packages like LangChain, LangGraph, AutoGen, Llamaindex and more.
* Practical experience with big data processing frameworks and platforms such as Azure, Databricks, Spark, with a focus on leveraging these technologies for building and scaling Generative AI solutions using Open AI services.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Excellent communication skills – able to translate sophisticated data science concepts to technical and non\\-technical partners, specifically within the context of building Generative AI solutions using Open AI services and scaling across Asia.
* Track record of implementing AI solutions into production with tangible business value, particularly related to Generative AI solutions. Eg. Chatbot, sales talking points, product comparisons

***When you join our team:***

* We’ll empower you to learn and grow the career you want.
* We’ll recognize and support you in a flexible environment where well\\-being and inclusion are more than just words.
* As part of our global team, we’ll support you in shaping the future you want to see.

**About Manulife and John Hancock**

Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services provider, helping people make their decisions easier and lives better. To learn more about us, visit https://www.manulife.com/en/about/our\\-story.html .


**Manulife is an Equal Opportunity Employer**

At Manulife/John Hancock, we embrace our diversity. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention, advancement and compensation, and we administer all of our practices and programs without discrimination on the basis of race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, religion or religious beliefs, creed, sex (including pregnancy and pregnancy\\-related conditions), sexual orientation, genetic characteristics, veteran status, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, family status, disability, or any other ground protected by applicable law.


It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will work with applicants who request a reasonable accommodation during the application process. All information shared during the accommodation request process will be stored and used in a manner that is consistent with applicable laws and Manulife/John Hancock policies. To request a reasonable accommodation in the application process, contact recruitment@manulife.com .


**Working Arrangement**

Hybrid

title: Security Analyst (L1)
description:
**Rule \\& responsibilities :** 

1\\. Analyst would be part of 24x7 Cyber Security Operations function to perform security monitoring and incident response, data loss prevention, vulnerability management.

2\\. Perform monitoring, research, assessment and analysis on alerts from various security tools, including IDPS tools, SIEM, Anomaly detection systems, firewalls, antivirus systems, user behavior analytics tools, endpoint inspection, and proxy devices.

3\\. Follow pre\\-defined actions to investigate possible security incidents or perform incident response actions, including escalating to other support groups.

4\\. Ensure proper functioning of systems in the Security Operations Centre.

5\\. Enhance and Build Cyber threat detection use cases and assist in analyzing \\& reducing false positive.

6\\. Support the development and enhancement of SOC incident response capabilities.

7\\. Respond to inbound Change Requests (CRs), Service Requests (SRs), Queries for handling Incident Management.

8\\. Execute daily ad hoc tasks or lead projects as needed.

**Requirement**

1\\. Minimum 2 years of working experience in IT environment.

2\\. Diploma/Degree in Information System/Information Security from a recognized institution. Strong knowledge on TCP/IP, Networking, Operating Systems and Cyber Security Concepts.

3\\. Strong level of experience with and understanding of firewalls, Antivirus and endpoint detection.

4\\. Good working knowledge of Linux including the ability to run command lines, editing files and scripting.

5\\. Knowledge of commonly\\-accepted information security principles and practices, as well as techniques attackers would use to identify vulnerabilities, gain unauthorized access, escalate privileges and access restricted information.

6\\. Solid understanding of threats reported by various data sources such as IDS/IPS, AV, HIDS/HIPS, WAFs, firewalls, and web proxies.

7\\. Excellent communication skills.

8\\. Experience in Scripting with Python, Bash or PowerShell is an advantage.

9\\. Willing to work with 24x7 shift pattern that includes weekend work and also extend shift hours if required.

10\\. Willingness to be on standby for maintaining 24x7 SOC shifts.

11\\. Hold one or more tech certification (e.g. MCP, MSCE, CCNA Security, CEH, Security\\+, CSA )

Job Type: Contract  
Contract length: 12 months

title: Bank Management & Data Analysis Coordinator
description:
**Bank Management \\& Data Analysis Coordinator**

**Role Purpose:**

The Bank Management \\& Data Analyst Coordinator is responsible for overseeing all aspects of bank\\-related processes and data analytics within the Individual Giving (IG) program. The role ensures smooth debit operations, accurate donor data management, and actionable insights for donor acquisition, retention, and development. As the PIC for Salesforce/CRM, this position safeguards data integrity, supports system optimization, and strengthens donor loyalty and experience through reliable reporting and operational excellence.


**What You will do:**

**Bank Management \\& Debit Oversight**

* Oversee auto\\-debit processes across partner banks and payment providers.
* Monitor and report on delinquency, failed transactions, and recovery rates.
* Coordinate with banks, Finance, and Donor Care teams for reconciliation and issue resolution.
* Ensure compliance with banking regulations, donor safeguarding, and data security in all processes.
* Identify process improvements to increase debit success rate and reduce attrition due to payment failure.
* Supervise Data Processing Officer for bank verification and data processing

**Data Analysis \\& Insights**

* Manage Individual Giving Dashboard including weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual report
* Conduct analysis on Individual Giving not limited to attrition, delinquency, acquisition, upgrade, reactivation, and appeal performance.
* Give recommendation on strategy based on data analysis, and support team to develop testing and flow.
* Support Management in income and performance forecasts
* Provide actionable insights to support decision\\-making in Donor Development and Loyalty \\& Experience.
* Track donor life cycle performance and contribute to long\\-term income planning.

**CRM \\& System Ownership**

* Act as the super admin for Salesforce/CRM, ensuring data accuracy, completeness, and consistency for the whole Individual Giving Business process from Acquisition, Retention and Development process.
* Manage workflows, automation, and integrations to optimize donor management systems.
* Provide training, troubleshooting, and user support to the IG team.
* Liaise with global/regional IT teams and vendors for system enhancements.
* Develop CRM Ecosystem to improve effectiveness and efficiency.

**Administrative \\& Cross\\-Team Support**

* Support reporting requirements for senior management, audits, and donor impact communications.
* Collaborate with Finance, Acquisition, and Retention teams for aligned data processes.
* Ensure timely delivery of reports and insights for operational and strategic planning.

**What We need from you:**

* Minimum 4\\-5 years working experience in related field
* Bachelor's degree in finance, Data Analytics, Statistics, IT, Data Science or related field.
* Proven experience in bank debit process management, CRM (preferably Salesforce), and data analytics.
* Strong skills in Excel, SQL, and data visualization (Power BI, Tableau, or similar).
* Knowledge of NGO fundraising, donor retention, and individual giving operations is an advantage.
* Excellent coordination, problem\\-solving, and communication skills.
* High attention to detail, integrity, and ability to manage cross\\-functional processes.

**Location: Jakarta**

**Save the Children encourages qualified candidates to apply regardless of religion, race, gender, sexual orientation, or disability.**

title: Analytics Business Developer
description:
### **Description**

  

This is a **strategic business development role**, not a hands\\-on delivery or cold\\-calling position. We're seeking a proactive, confident, and emotionally intelligent strategist to lead data and analytics innovations for our top\\-tier eCommerce clients.  

If you thrive on solving complex problems, communicating insights clearly to C\\-level executives, and believe analytics is a strategic force for commercial success, this role is for you.### **What are the responsibilities of an Analytics Business Developer?**

  

Your primary mission will be to expand our analytics partnerships, with a focus of \\~70% on our existing portfolio of 150\\+ clients and \\~30% on warm, incoming leads.* **Drive strategic growth:** proactively identify and develop new commercial opportunities within our client base, guiding them up the data maturity ladder.
* **Consult and architect solutions:** assess client needs and design tailored, long\\-term analytics roadmaps – from foundational web analytics and BI dashboards to advanced Customer Data Platform (CDP) integrations and predictive models.
* **Collaborate for deeper insights:** partner with internal Key Account Managers to gain deep client intelligence on business context and challenges. Work closely with our Data Strategists and Analysts to audit existing analytics architectures, identify issues, and uncover opportunities to craft perfectly tailored proposals.
* **Lead C\\-suite and top management conversations:** engage directly with C\\-level executives or top managers from the client side to understand their business challenges, present compelling data\\-driven strategies, and secure buy\\-in for high\\-impact projects.
* **Develop winning proposals:** collaborate with our internal analytics experts to craft and present proposals that clearly articulate the business value and technical approach of our solutions.
* **Become a trusted advisor:** act as the primary analytics strategy contact for key accounts, translating complex data concepts into actionable commercial insights and building lasting partnerships.

  

### **What do we expect from you?**

  

We hire for mindset and impact first. We're looking for someone who takes charge, communicates directly, and digs deep to solve problems independently.* Experience of 2\\-5\\+ years in a senior\\-level data strategy, analytics, or strategic business development role, with proven success in using data to drive sales and business growth.
* **Commercial intellect:** a strong ability to translate complex data into clear, actionable commercial strategy and articulate its value persuasively to both technical and non\\-technical stakeholders.
* **Technical comprehensiveness:** a solid understanding of the modern data stack and key analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, GTM, CDPs, BigQuery, Snowflake, Tableau). You don't need to be a hands\\-on expert in all, but you must speak the language fluently.
* **Social intelligence:** exceptional communication and client relationship skills. You know how to read a room, build authentic influence, and lead executive conversations with confidence and candor.
* **Mindset:** a proactive self\\-starter who operates best when given a mission and the freedom to achieve it. You are internally motivated by self\\-development and relevance.

  

### **What we offer**

  

* Competitive starting salary relative to the market;
* Substantial monetary bonuses based on successful lead conversion to a client;
* Exciting travel opportunities;
* Support for hardware upgrades;
* Core health insurance coverage and sports bonuses;
* A diverse multinational team of experts to learn from;
* Company\\-covered training and certification;
* Legendary online and onsite events to celebrate our success together.

  

### **About scandiweb**


scandiweb is the leading digital experience partner for ambitious eCommerce brands. With over 20 years of expertise, we deliver enterprise\\-level solutions powered by AI, technological innovation, and the best talents globally.
  

Our portfolio includes industry giants like Samsung, Läderach, Jaguar, BMW, Walmart, and Puma. Yet, our solutions go beyond platforms — we craft future\\-proof, high\\-performance digital ecosystems tailored to each client’s vision.
  

With a focus on quality and innovation, we tailor our solutions to each brand’s unique goals — ensuring flexibility, scalability, and long\\-term success. Backed by an international team of top\\-tier professionals, we merge efficiency, strategy, and innovation to push eCommerce forward.
  

At scandiweb, we work hard, innovate relentlessly, and celebrate success with purpose.

title: Sales Analytic Manager
description:
If you're someone who thrives on turning data into insights, loves building smart systems, and gets excited about driving business impact through analytics, this could be the perfect opportunity for you.



About the Job


Based in Jakarta and reporting to our Digital Sales Transformation Manager, you’ll play a pivotal role in shaping how we use data to make strategic decisions. From building robust forecasts to designing Power BI dashboards and streamlining reporting processes, your work will directly influence how we grow and win in the market. You’ll collaborate with our global and regional teams, commercial leaders, and external partners to ensure our sales data is accurate, actionable, and aligned with our business goals. And as a people leader, you’ll guide a team of Sales Analysts to deliver high\\-impact insights and foster a culture of continuous improvement. Join us and let’s \\#DoSomethingThatMatters ��



About Multi Bintang Indonesia
  

You might think that we’re just one iconic brand, but we’re actually so much more.
  

As the pioneer of the beer industry in Indonesia with a proud history of over than 90 years in the country, Multi Bintang Indonesia is synonymous with BINTANG, Indonesia’s favorite and most iconic beer brand. As part of the HEINEKEN Company, Multi Bintang Indonesia also produces and markets the world’s most valuable international premium beer brand, Heineken®, as well as a portfolio of other beer brands, such as including Tiger Soju Flavoured Lager, BINTANG Pilsner, BINTANG Crystal, BINTANG Anggur Merah, BINTANG Arak Jeruk \\& Madu, and BINTANG 0\\.0\\.
  

We believe in making a positive impact and creating a real change in the world. Join us and let’s do something that matters!
  

At Multi Bintang Indonesia, we offer a world of opportunities for your career development. Be part of something bigger than yourself, create real change in the world, and make positive impact through your careers!


Main Responsibilities


* Lead the development of annual forecasts and market share projections


* Build, automate and optimize Power BI dashboards and reporting systems


* Ensure data accuracy across SAP, DIS, and PBI platforms


* Collaborate with global, regional, and local stakeholders for data\\-driven decision\\-making


* Mentor and develop a team of Sales Analysts


* Drive reporting process improvements and sales process optimization



Candidate Criteria


* Minimum 8 years in sales business analytics or related roles


* At least 2 years in a managerial position


* Experienced in automation of reports


* Strong business acumen and technical proficiency in analytics tools


* Experience in FMCG sales is a strong plus


* Fluent in English (oral and written)


* Proficient in Excel, Power BI, and SAP

title: Data & AI Presales Consultant (Indonesia)
description:
Job Function: Sales The role:

Are you ready to architect transformative data and AI solutions?  

Do you thrive on turning complex information into business advantage?  

Would you like to work with cutting\\-edge cloud technologies to unlock insights for our organisation?  

You’ll join our **Data \\& Analytics team**, partnering with business stakeholders across the organisation to drive innovation in how we collect, model and act on information.  

As the Solution Architect for Data \\& AI, you play a pivotal part in shaping how our business harnesses its data. You design and build the blueprint for our analytics and generative\\-AI capabilities on the AWS platform so that teams can make better decisions, solve complex problems and deliver value. **What You’ll Do:*** Design end\\-to\\-end analytics and AI solutions: Work with stakeholders to gather needs, sketch the architecture and document the big picture.
* Architect on AWS: Apply your expertise with services such as Redshift, EMR, Kinesis, Glue, QuickSight and the suite of AI/ML and generative\\-AI tools to build robust, scalable platforms.

* Deep familiarity with the AWS analytics and AI family (Redshift, EMR, Kinesis, Glue, QuickSight and related AI/ML/generative\\-AI offerings) and an enthusiasm for exploring new services.
* Comfort writing code and queries – you work fluently in Python and SQL (or similar languages) to manipulate, transform and interrogate data.
* Excellent problem\\-solving, communication and collaboration skills – you can translate business questions into technical designs and work effectively with both technical and non\\-technical colleagues.
* Experience working in an Agile environment, version controlling your work and adapting as priorities evolve.
* Relevant qualifications: a degree in an IT\\-related discipline or equivalent, plus current AWS certifications (Solution Architect, Data Analytics Specialty or the equivalent).

SoftwareOne and Crayon have come together to form a global, AI\\-powered software and cloud solutions provider with a bold vision for the future.
